verses.latin: Primum quidem sermonem feci de omnibus, o Theophile, quae coepit Iesus facere et docere,
verses.english: My first account, O Theophilus, described everything that Jesus began to do and to teach,

verses.latin: usque in diem, qua praecipiens Apostolis per Spiritum Sanctum, quos elegit, assumptus est.
verses.english: until the very day when, after giving instructions to the apostles whom he had chosen through the Holy Spirit, he was taken up to Heaven.

verses.latin: Quibus et ostendit se ipsum vivum post passionem suam in multis argumentis, per dies quadraginta apparens eis, et loquens de regno Dei.
verses.english: To them he also presented himself alive after his passion by many proofs, appearing to them during forty days and speaking about the kingdom of God.

verses.latin: Et convescens, praecepit eis ab Jerosolymis ne discederent, sed exspectarent promissionem Patris, quam audistis, inquit, ex me.
verses.english: And while staying with them, he ordered them not to depart from Jerusalem, but to wait for the promise of the Father, which, he said, “you heard from me;

verses.latin: quia Joannes quidem baptizavit aqua, vos autem baptizabimini Spiritu Sancto non post multos hos dies.
verses.english: for John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”

verses.latin: Igitur qui convenerant, interrogabant eum, dicentes: Domine, si in tempore hoc restituis regnum Israël?
verses.english: So when they had come together, they asked him, “Lord, will you at this time restore the kingdom to Israel?”

verses.latin: Dixit autem eis: Non est vestrum nosse tempora vel momenta, quae Pater posuit in sua potestate:
verses.english: He said to them, “It is not for you to know times or seasons that the Father has fixed by his own authority.

verses.latin: sed accipietis virtutem supervenientis Spiritus Sancti in vos, et eritis mihi testes in Jerusalem, et in omni Judaea, et Samaria, et usque ad ultimum terrae.
verses.english: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you, and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the end of the earth.”

verses.latin: Et cum haec dixisset, videntibus illis, elevatus est: et nubes suscepit eum ab oculis eorum.
verses.english: And when he had said these things, as they were looking on, he was taken up, and a cloud received him out of their sight.

verses.latin: Et cum intuerentur in caelum euntem illum, ecce duo viri astiterunt juxta illos in vestibus albis,
verses.english: And as they were gazing into heaven as he went, behold, two men stood by them in white robes,

verses.latin: qui et dixerunt: Viri Galilaei, quid statis aspicientes in caelum? Hic Iesus, qui assumptus est a vobis in caelum, sic veniet, quemadmodum vidistis eum euntem in caelum.
verses.english: and said, “Men of Galilee, why do you stand looking into heaven? This Jesus, who was taken up from you into heaven, will come in the same way as you saw him go into heaven.”

verses.latin: Tunc reversi sunt Jerosolymam a monte qui vocatur Oliveti, qui est juxta Jerusalem, sabbati habens iter.
verses.english: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day's journey away.

verses.latin: Et cum introissent, in cenaculum ascenderunt, ubi manebant Petrus, et Joannes, Jacobus, et Andreas, Philippus, et Thomas, Bartholomaeus, et Matthaeus, Jacobus, filius Alphaei, et Simon Zelotes, et Judas Jacobi.
verses.english: And when they had entered, they went up to the upper room, where they were staying, Peter and John and James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot and Judas the son of James.

verses.latin: Hi omnes erant perseverantes unanimiter in oratione cum mulieribus, et Maria matre Jesu, et fratribus ejus.
verses.english: All these with one accord were devoting themselves to prayer, together with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus, and his brothers.

verses.latin: In diebus illis, exsurgens Petrus in medio fratrum dixit (erat autem turba hominum simul, fere centum viginti):
verses.english: In those days Peter stood up among the brothers (the company of persons was in all about 120) and said,

verses.latin: Viri fratres, oportet impleri Scripturam, quam praedixit Spiritus Sanctus per os David de Juda, qui fuit dux eorum, qui comprehenderunt Jesum:
verses.english: “Brothers, the Scripture had to be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke beforehand by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who was guide to those who arrested Jesus.

verses.latin: quia connumeratus erat in nobis, et sortitus est sortem ministerii hujus.
verses.english: For he was numbered among us and was allotted his share in this ministry.”

verses.latin: Hic igitur possedit agrum de mercede iniquitatis, et suspensus crepuit medius, et diffusa sunt omnia intestina ejus.
verses.english: Now this man acquired a field with the reward of his wickedness, and falling headlong, he burst open in the middle and all his bowels gushed out.

verses.latin: Et notum factum est omnibus habitantibus Jerusalem, ita ut appellaretur ager ille, in lingua eorum, Haceldamach, id est, ager sanguinis.
verses.english: And it became known to all the residents of Jerusalem, so that the field was called in their own language Akeldama, that is, Field of Blood.

verses.latin: Scriptum est enim in libro Psalmorum: Fiat deserta mansio ejus, et non sit qui inhabitet in ea: et episcopatum ejus accipiat alter.
verses.english: For it is written in the book of Psalms, ‘May his camp become desolate, and let there be no one to dwell in it,’ and ‘May another take his office.’

verses.latin: Oportet ergo ex his, qui nobiscum fuerunt viris in omni tempore, quo intravit et exivit inter nos Dominus Jesus,
verses.english: So one of the men who have accompanied us during all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,

verses.latin: incipiens a baptismate Joannis usque in diem, qua assumptus est a nobis, testem resurrectionis ejus nobiscum fieri unum ex istis.
verses.english: beginning from the baptism of John until the day when he was taken up from us—one of these men must become with us a witness to his resurrection.”

verses.latin: Et statuerunt duos, Joseph, qui vocabatur Barsabbas, qui cognominatus est Justus, et Matthiam.
verses.english: And they put forward two, Joseph called Barsabbas, who was also called Justus, and Matthias.

verses.latin: Et orantes dixerunt: Tu, Domine, qui corda nosti omnium, ostende quem elegeris ex his duobus unum,
verses.english: And they prayed and said, “You, Lord, who know the hearts of all, show which one of these two you have chosen

verses.latin: ut accipiat locum ministerii hujus et apostolatus, de quo praevaricatus est Judas, ut iret in locum suum.
verses.english: to take the place in this ministry and apostleship from which Judas turned aside to go to his own place.”

verses.latin: Et dederunt sortes eis, et cecidit sors super Matthiam, et annumeratus est cum undecim Apostolis.
verses.english: And they cast lots for them, and the lot fell on Matthias, and he was added to the eleven apostles.

verses.latin: Et cum complerentur dies Pentecostes, erant omnes pariter in eodem loco:
verses.english: When the day of Pentecost arrived, everyone was together in the same place:

verses.latin: et factus est repente de caelo sonus, tamquam advenientis spiritus vehementis, et replevit totam domum ubi erant sedentes.
verses.english: Then, suddenly, there was a sound that came from the sky, like a rushing, violent wind, and it filled the entire house where they were sitting.

verses.latin: Et apparuerunt illis dispertitae linguae tamquam ignis, seditque supra singulos eorum.
verses.english: Tongues, divided like flames of fire, appeared to them, and settled on each of them.

verses.latin: Et repleti sunt omnes Spiritu Sancto, et coeperunt loqui variis linguis, prout Spiritus Sanctus dabat illis pronuntiare.
verses.english: All were filled with the Holy Spirit, and began to speak in different languages, as the Holy Spirit enabled them to speak.

verses.latin: Erant autem in Ierusalem habitantes Judaei, viri religiosi ex omni natione, quae sub caelo est.
verses.english: Now there were Jews living in Jerusalem, devout men from every nation under the sky.

verses.latin: Facta autem hac voce, convenit multitudo, et mente confusa est, quoniam audiebat unusquisque lingua sua illos loquentes.
verses.english: At this sound, a crowd gathered and was confused, because each one heard them speaking in his own language.

verses.latin: Stupebant autem omnes, et mirabantur, dicentes: Nonne ecce omnes isti, qui loquuntur, Galilaei sunt?
verses.english: They were astonished and amazed, saying, “Are not all these who are speaking Galileans?

verses.latin: et quomodo nos audimus unusquisque linguam nostram, in qua nati sumus?
verses.english: “And how is it that we hear, each in our own language in which we were born?

verses.latin: Parthi, et Medi, et Aelamitae, et qui habitant Mesapotamiam, Judaeam, et Cappadociam, Pontum, et Asiam,
verses.english: Parthians, Medes, and Elamites, and the residents of Mesopotamia, Judea, and Cappadocia, Pontus, and Asia,

verses.latin: Phrygiam, et Pamphyliam, Aegyptum, et partes Libyae, quae est circa Cyrenen, et advenae Romani,
verses.english: Phrygia, and Pamphylia, Egypt, and the regions of Libya near Cyrene, and visitors from Rome,

verses.latin: Judaei quoque, et proselyti, Cretenses, et Arabes: audimus eos loquentes magnis de mirabilibus Dei.
verses.english: both Jews and converts to Judaism, Cretans and Arabs; we hear them speaking about the great works of God in our own tongues.”

verses.latin: Stupebant autem omnes, et mirabantur, dicentes invicem: Quidnam hoc vult esse?
verses.english: All were amazed and perplexed, saying to one another, “What does this mean?”

verses.latin: Alii autem irridentes, dicebant: Quia musto pleni sunt hi.
verses.english: But others, mocking, said, “They are filled with sweet wine.”

verses.latin: Stans autem Petrus cum undecim, levavit vocem suam, et locutus est eis: Viri Judaei, et qui habitatis Ierusalem, universi, hoc vobis notum sit, et auribus percipite verba mea.
verses.english: Then Peter stood up with the eleven, raised his voice, and addressed them: “Men of Judea and all who live in Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and give ear to my words:

verses.latin: Non enim, sicut vos aestimatis, hi ebrii sunt, cum sit hora diei tertia:
verses.english: “For these people are not drunk, as you suppose, since it is only the third hour of the day.

verses.latin: sed hoc est quod dictum est per prophetam Joel:
verses.english: “No, this is what was spoken through the prophet Joel:

verses.latin: Et erit in novissimis diebus, dicit Dominus, effundam de Spiritu meo super omnem carnem: et prophetabunt filii vestri, et filiae vestrae, et juvenes vestri visiones videbunt, et seniores vestri somnia somniabunt.
verses.english: ‘In the last days, God says, I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh; and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, and your young men shall see visions, and your old men shall dream dreams.

verses.latin: Et super servos meos, et super ancillas meas, effundam in diebus illis de Spiritu meo, et prophetabunt.
verses.english: ‘Even on my male servants and female servants in those days, I will pour out my Spirit, and they shall prophesy.

verses.latin: Et dabo prodigia in caelo sursum, et signa in terra deorsum, sanguinem, et ignem, et vaporis fumi.
verses.english: ‘And I will show wonders in the sky above, and signs on the earth below: blood, and fire, and a cloud of smoke.

verses.latin: Sol convertetur in tenebras, et luna in sanguinem, antequam veniat dies Domini magnus et manifestus.
verses.english: ‘The sun will be turned to darkness, and the moon to blood, before the coming of the great and glorious day of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et erit: omnis quicumque invocaverit nomen Domini, salvus erit.
verses.english: ‘And it will be that everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.’

verses.latin: Viri Israelitae, audite verba haec: Iesum Nazarenum, virum approbatum a Deo in vobis, virtutibus, et prodigiis, et signis, quae fecit per illum Deus in medio vestri, sicut et vos scitis:
verses.english: “Men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus the Nazarene, a man attested to you by God with mighty works and wonders and signs, which God worked through him in your midst, as you yourselves know—

verses.latin: hunc, determinato consilio, et praescientia Dei traditum, per manus iniquorum affligentes interemistis:
verses.english: this man, delivered up by the set plan and foreknowledge of God, you crucified and killed by the hands of those outside the law.

verses.latin: quem Deus suscitavit, solutis doloribus inferni, sicut non erat possibile teneri illum ab eo.
verses.english: “But God raised him up, releasing him from the pains of death, because it was impossible for him to be held in its power.

verses.latin: David enim dicit de illo: Providebam Dominum in conspectu meo semper: quoniam a dextris meis est, ne commovear:
verses.english: “For David says concerning him, ‘I saw the Lord always before me, because he is at my right hand, so that I will not be shaken.

verses.latin: propter hoc laetatum est cor meum, et exultavit lingua mea, insuper et caro mea requiescet in spe:
verses.english: ‘Therefore my heart was glad, and my tongue rejoiced; moreover, my flesh will also dwell in hope.

verses.latin: quoniam non derelinques animam meam in inferno, nec dabis sanctum tuum videre corruptionem.
verses.english: ‘For you will not abandon my soul in Hades, nor will you let your Holy One see corruption.

verses.latin: Notum mihi fecisti vias vitae; adimplebis me jucunditate cum vultu tuo.
verses.english: ‘You made known to me the ways of life; you will fill me with joy with your presence.’

verses.latin: Viri fratres, liceat audenter dicere ad vos de patriarcha David, quoniam et defunctus est, et sepultus: et sepulchrum ejus est apud nos usque in hodiernum diem.
verses.english: “Brothers, I may say to you confidently of the patriarch David that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.

verses.latin: Propheta igitur cum esset, et sciret quia juramento juravit illi Deus de fructu lumbi ejus sedere super sedem ejus:
verses.english: “Being therefore a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him that he would set one of his descendants on his throne,

verses.latin: prospiciens, locutus est de resurrectione Christi: Quia non est relictus in inferno, neque caro ejus vidit corruptionem.
verses.english: he foresaw and spoke about the resurrection of the Christ, that he was not abandoned in Hades, nor did his flesh see corruption.

verses.latin: Hunc Iesum resuscitavit Deus: cujus omnes nos testes sumus.
verses.english: “This Jesus God raised up, and of that we all are witnesses.

verses.latin: Dextera igitur Dei exaltatus, et promissione Spiritus Sancti accepta a Patre, effudit hunc, quem vos nunc videtis, et auditis.
verses.english: “Being therefore exalted at the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, he has poured out this that you yourselves are seeing and hearing.

verses.latin: David enim non ascendit in caelos: dicit autem ipse: Dixit Dominus Domino meo: Sede a dextris meis,
verses.english: “For David did not ascend into the heavens, but he says, ‘The Lord said to my Lord: Sit at my right hand,

verses.latin: donec ponam inimicos tuos scabellum pedum tuorum.
verses.english: ‘until I make your enemies your footstool.’

verses.latin: Certissime ergo sciat omnis domus Israel, quia et Dominum eum, et Christum fecit Deus hunc Iesum, quem vos crucifixistis.
verses.english: “Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly that God has made him both Lord and Christ—this Jesus whom you crucified.”

verses.latin: Hoc autem audientes, compuncti sunt corde, et dixerunt ad Petrum, et ad reliquos apostolos: Quid faciemus, viri fratres?
verses.english: Now when they heard this, they were cut to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, “Brothers, what are we to do?”

verses.latin: Petrus vero ad illos: Paenitentiam, inquit, agite, et baptizetur unusquisque vestrum in nomine Iesu Christi in remissionem peccatorum vestrorum: et accipietis donum Spiritus Sancti.
verses.english: And Peter said to them, “Repent and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: Vobis enim est repromissio, et filiis vestris, et omnibus qui longe sunt, quoscumque advocaverit Dominus Deus noster.
verses.english: “For the promise is to you and to your children and to all those far off, everyone whom the Lord our God calls to himself.”

verses.latin: Aliis etiam verbis pluribus testificatus est, et exhortabatur eos, dicens: Salvamini a generatione ista prava.
verses.english: And with many other words he bore witness and continued to exhort them, saying, “Save yourselves from this crooked generation.”

verses.latin: Qui ergo receperunt sermonem ejus, baptizati sunt: et appositae sunt in die illa animae circiter tria millia.
verses.english: So those who received his word were baptized, and that day about three thousand souls were added.

verses.latin: Erant autem perseverantes in doctrina apostolorum, et communicatione, et in fractione panis, et in orationibus.
verses.english: And they devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching and fellowship, to the breaking of bread and the prayers.

verses.latin: Fiebant autem omni animae timor: multa quoque prodigia et signa fiebant per apostolos in Ierusalem, et metus erat magnus in universis.
verses.english: And fear came upon every soul, and many wonders and signs were being done through the apostles. And all who believed were together and had all things in common.

verses.latin: Omnes etiam qui credebant, erant pariter, et habebant omnia communia.
verses.english: And all who believed were together and had all things in common.

verses.latin: Possessiones et substantias vendebant, et dividebant illa omnibus, prout cuique opus erat.
verses.english: And they were selling their possessions and belongings and distributing the proceeds to all, as any had need.

verses.latin: Quotidianis quoque perseverantes unanimiter in templo, et frangentes panem in domibus, sumebant cibum cum exultatione et simplicitate cordis,
verses.english: And day by day, attending the temple together and breaking bread in their homes, they partook of food with glad and generous hearts,

verses.latin: collaudantes Deum, et habentes gratiam ad omnem plebem. Dominus autem augebat qui salvi fierent quotidie in idipsum.
verses.english: praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to their number day by day those who were being saved.

verses.latin: Petrus autem et Ioannes ascendebant in templum ad horam orationis nonam.
verses.english: Peter and John were going into the temple during the ninth hour of prayer.

verses.latin: Et quidam vir, qui claudus erat a nativitate, asportabatur: quem ponebant quotidie ad portam templi, quae dicitur Speciosa, ut peteret eleemosynam ab introëuntibus in templum.
verses.english: A certain man, who was lame from birth, was being carried in: they put him every day at the gate of the temple, which is called Beautiful, so that he might ask for alms from those going into the temple.

verses.latin: Is cum vidisset Petrum et Ioannem incipientes introire in templum, rogabat ut eleemosynam acciperet.
verses.english: When he saw Peter and John beginning to enter the temple, he asked that he might receive alms.

verses.latin: Intuens autem in eum Petrus cum Ioanne, dixit: Respice in nos.
verses.english: But Peter, with John, looked intently at him, saying, “Look at us.”

verses.latin: At ille intendebat in eos, sperans se aliquid accepturum ab eis.
verses.english: And he paid attention to them, hoping that he would receive something from them.

verses.latin: Petrus autem dixit: Argentum et aurum non est mihi: quod autem habeo, hoc tibi do. In nomine Iesu Christi Nazareni surge et ambula.
verses.english: But Peter said, “I have neither silver nor gold, but what I have, I give to you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, rise up and walk.”

verses.latin: Et aprehensa manu eius dextera, elevavit eum: et protinus consolidatae sunt bases eius et plantae.
verses.english: And having taken him by the right hand, he raised him up. And immediately his feet and ankles were strengthened.

verses.latin: Et exiliens stetit, et ambulabat, et intravit cum illis in templum ambulans, et exiliens, et laudans Deum.
verses.english: And leaping up, he stood, and walked, and entered with them into the temple, walking and leaping, and praising God.

verses.latin: Et vidit eum omnis populus ambulantem et laudantem Deum.
verses.english: And all the people saw him walking and praising God.

verses.latin: Cognoscebant autem illum, quod ipse erat qui ad eleemosynam sedebat ad speciosa porta templi: et impleti sunt stupore et extasi in eo quod contigerat illi.
verses.english: And they recognized him as the one who used to sit begging at the Beautiful Gate of the temple, and they were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.

verses.latin: Cum teneret autem Petrum et Ioannem, concurrit omnis populus ad eos ad porticum, quae appellatur Salomonis, stupentes.
verses.english: And while he was holding Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the portico, which is called Solomon’s, astonished.

verses.latin: Videns autem Petrus, respondit ad populum: Viri Israelitae, quid miramini in hoc? aut quid nos aspicitis, quasi nostra virtute aut potestate fecerimus hunc ambulare?
verses.english: But when Peter saw this, he responded to the people: “Men of Israel, why are you amazed at this? Or why do you stare at us, as though by our own power or piety we had made this man walk?

verses.latin: Deus Abraham, et Deus Isaac, et Deus Iacob, Deus patrum nostrorum, glorificavit filium suum Iesum, quem vos quidem tradidistis, et negastis ante faciem Pilati, iudicante illo dimittendum.
verses.english: The God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified His Son Jesus, whom you delivered up and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he had decided to release Him.

verses.latin: Vos autem sanctum et iustum negastis, et petistis virum homicidam donari vobis:
verses.english: But you denied the Holy and Righteous One, and asked that a murderer be granted to you,

verses.latin: auctorem vero vitae interfecistis, quem Deus suscitavit a mortuis, cuius nos testes sumus.
verses.english: and you killed the Author of life, whom God raised from the dead, to which we are witnesses.

verses.latin: Et in fide nominis eius, hunc, quem vos vidistis et nostis, confirmavit nomen eius: et fides, quae per eum est, dedit ei hanc integritatem in conspectu omnium vestrum.
verses.english: And on the basis of faith in His name, His name has strengthened this man whom you see and know. And the faith that comes through Him has given the man this complete healing in the presence of you all.

verses.latin: Et nunc, fratres, scio quia per ignorantiam fecistis, sicut et principes vestri.
verses.english: And now, brothers, I know that you acted in ignorance, as did also your leaders.

verses.latin: Deus autem, quae praenuntiavit per os omnium prophetarum, pati Christum suum, sic implevit.
verses.english: But God fulfilled what He foretold by the mouth of all the prophets, that His Christ would suffer.

verses.latin: Poenitentiam itaque agentes, et convertimini, ut deleantur peccata vestra:
verses.english: Therefore, repent and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out,

verses.latin: ut veniant tempora refrigerii a conspectu Domini, et mittat eum, qui praedicatus est vobis Iesum Christum,
verses.english: so that times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord, and that He may send Jesus Christ, who was preached to you,

verses.latin: quem oportet caelum quidem suscipere, usque in tempora restitutionis omnium, quae locutus est Deus per os sanctorum suorum prophetarum a saeculo.
verses.english: whom heaven must receive until the times of the restoration of all things, which God spoke about by the mouth of His holy prophets from ancient times.

verses.latin: Moyses quidem dixit: Prophetam vobis suscitabit Dominus Deus vester de fratribus vestris, tamquam me: ipsum audietis juxta omnia quaecumque locutus fuerit vobis.
verses.english: For Moses said, “The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your brothers. You must listen to Him in everything He tells you.

verses.latin: Erit autem, omnis anima quae non audierit prophetam illum, exterminabitur de plebe.
verses.english: And it will be that every soul that does not listen to that prophet will be utterly destroyed from the people.”

verses.latin: Et omnes prophetae a Samuhel et deinceps, quotquot locuti sunt, et praenuntiaverunt dies istos.
verses.english: And all the prophets from Samuel and those who followed, as many as have spoken, have also foretold these days.

verses.latin: Vos estis filii prophetarum, et testamenti, quod disposuit Deus ad patres vestros, dicens ad Abraham: Et in semine tuo benedicentur omnes familiae terrae.
verses.english: You are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant that God made with your fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘And in your seed all the families of the earth will be blessed.’

verses.latin: Vobis primum Deus suscitans filium suum, misit eum, benedicentem vobis, ut convertat se unusquisque a nequitiis suis.
verses.english: To you first, God, having raised up His Son, sent Him to bless you by turning each of you from your wicked ways.”

verses.latin: Loquente autem illis ad populum, supervenerunt ad eos sacerdotes et magistratus templi et sadducæi,
verses.english: While Peter and John were speaking to the crowd, the priests and the captain of the temple guard and the Sadducees approached them,

verses.latin: dolentes quod docerent populum, et annuntiarent in Jesu resurrectionem a mortuis,
verses.english: they were angry that Peter and John were teaching the people and proclaiming in Jesus the resurrection from the dead,

verses.latin: et injecerunt in eos manus, et posuerunt eos in custodiam in crastinum: jam enim vespera erat.
verses.english: and they seized them and put them in prison until the next day, because it was already evening.

verses.latin: Multi autem eorum, qui audierant verbum, crediderunt: et factus est numerus virorum, quasi quinque millia.
verses.english: However, many of those who heard the message believed, and the number of men came to about five thousand.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in crastinum, ut congregarentur principes eorum, et seniores, et scribæ in Jerusalem:
verses.english: On the next day, the rulers, elders, and scribes gathered in Jerusalem:

verses.latin: et Annas princeps sacerdotum, et Caiaphas, et Joannes, et Alexander, et quotquot erant de genere sacerdotali.
verses.english: Annas the high priest, Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and all those who were of the priestly race.

verses.latin: Et statuentes eos in medio, interrogaverunt: In qua virtute, aut in quo nomine fecistis hoc vos?
verses.english: And putting Peter and John in the middle, they questioned them: “By what power or by what name did you do this?”

verses.latin: Tunc Petrus, repletus Spiritu Sancto, dixit ad eos: Principes populi, et seniores,
verses.english: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them: “Leaders of the people and elders,

verses.latin: si nos hodie interro gamur in benefacto hominis infirmis, in quo iste sanatus est,
verses.english: if we are being examined today about a good deed done to a weak man, and by what means he was healed,

verses.latin: notum sit omnibus vobis, et omni plebi Israël: quia in nomine Domini nostri Jesu Christi Nazareni, quem vos crucifixistis, quem Deus suscitavit a mortuis, in hoc iste assistit coram vobis sanus.
verses.english: then know this, you and all the people of Israel: It is by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified and whom God raised from the dead, that this man is standing before you healed.

verses.latin: Hic est lapis, qui reprobatus est a vobis ædificantibus, qui factus est in caput anguli:
verses.english: This is the stone that was rejected by you, the builders, and has become the cornerstone:

verses.latin: Et non est in alio aliquo salus. Nec enim nomen aliud est sub cælo datum hominibus, in quo oporteat nos salvos fieri.
verses.english: And there is salvation in no one else, because there is no other name under heaven given among men by which we must be saved.”

verses.latin: Videntes autem Petri constantiam, et Joannis, intellecto quod homines essent sine litteris et idioti, mirabantur: et cognoscebant eos quod cum Jesu fuissent:
verses.english: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and realized that they were uneducated men, they were astonished, and they recognized that they had been with Jesus.

verses.latin: videntem autem hominem stantem cum eis, quem sanatum fuerat, nihil habebant contradicere.
verses.english: And seeing the man who had been healed standing with them, they had nothing to say against it.

verses.latin: Jusserunt autem eos foras consilii secedere: et conferebant ad invicem, dicentes:
verses.english: But when they had ordered them to leave the council, they conferred with one another, saying:

verses.latin: Quid faciemus hominibus istis? Quia quidem notum signum factum est per eos, manifestum omnibus habitantibus Jerusalem: et negare non possumus.
verses.english: “What are we going to do with these men? For a notable sign has been done through them, which is obvious to all who dwell in Jerusalem, and we cannot deny it.

verses.latin: Sed ne amplius divulgatur in populo, comminemur eis ne ultra loquantur in nomine hoc alicui hominum.
verses.english: But so that it may spread no further among the people, let us warn them that they speak no more to anyone in this name.”

verses.latin: Et vocantes eos, denuntiaverunt, ne omnino loquerentur, neque docerent in nomine Jesu.
verses.english: So they called them and commanded them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus.

verses.latin: Petrus autem et Joannes respondentes, dixerunt ad eos: Si justum est in conspectu Dei, vos potius audire, quam Deum, judicate.
verses.english: But Peter and John answered them, “Judge for yourselves whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you rather than to God.

verses.latin: Non enim possumus quæ vidimus et audivimus, non loqui.
verses.english: For we cannot help but speak about what we have seen and heard.”

verses.latin: At illi, comminantes, dimiserunt eos: non invenientes quomodo punirent eos, propter populum: quia omnes clarificabant Deum in eo quod factum fuerat.
verses.english: So when they had further threatened them, they let them go, because they could not find any way to punish them, on account of the people, because all were glorifying God for what had been done.

verses.latin: Annus enim erat amplius quadraginta, in quo factus est sanus homo, in quo operata est hæc curatio.
verses.english: For the man on whom this miracle of healing had been performed was over forty years old.

verses.latin: Dimissi autem venerunt ad suos, et annuntiaverunt eis quanta ad eos principes sacerdotum et seniores dixissent.
verses.english: When they were released, they went to their own people and reported everything that the chief priests and the elders had said to them.

verses.latin: Qui cum audissent, una voce, levaverunt vocem ad Deum, et dixerunt: Domine, tu es qui fecisti cælum et terram, et mare, et omnia quæ in eis sunt:
verses.english: And when they heard it, with one accord they raised their voices to God and said: “Lord, you are the one who made the universe, the earth, the sea, and everything in them.

verses.latin: qui per Spiritum Sanctum, per os patris nostri David, pueri tui, dixisti: Quare fremuerunt gentes: et populi meditati sunt inania?
verses.english: By the Holy Spirit you said through the mouth of our father David, your servant: ‘Why did the nations rage, and the peoples devise empty things?

verses.latin: Astiterunt reges terræ, et principes convenerunt in unum adversus Dominum, et adversus Christum ejus.
verses.english: The kings of the earth rose up, and the rulers gathered together against the Lord and against His Christ.’

verses.latin: Nam congregati sunt vere in civitate ista adversus sanctum puerum tuum Jesum, quem unxisti, Herodes, et Pontius Pilatus, cum gentibus, et populis Israël,
verses.english: For truly in this city there were gathered together against your holy servant Jesus, whom you anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the peoples of Israel,

verses.latin: facere quæ manus tua et consilium tuum decreverunt fieri.
verses.english: to do whatever your hand and your plan had predestined to happen.

verses.latin: Et nunc, Domine, respice in minas eorum, et da servis tuis cum omni fiducia loqui verbum tuum,
verses.english: And now, Lord, look upon their threats and grant to your servants to speak your word with all boldness,

verses.latin: in eo quod manum tuam extendas ad sanandum, et signa et prodigia fieri per nomen sancti Filii tui Jesu.
verses.english: while you stretch out your hand to heal, and signs and wonders are performed through the name of your holy servant Jesus.”

verses.latin: Et cum orassent, motus est locus in quo erant congregati: et repleti sunt omnes Spiritu Sancto, et loquebantur verbum Dei cum fiducia.
verses.english: And when they had prayed, the place in which they were gathered was shaken, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and spoke the word of God with boldness.

verses.latin: Multitudinis autem credentium erat cor unum et anima una: nec quisquam eorum quæ sua erant, dicebat esse, sed erant illis omnia communia.
verses.english: Now the multitude of those who believed were of one heart and soul, and no one claimed that anything of what he possessed was his own, but they held everything in common.

verses.latin: Et magna virtute reddebant testimonium apostoli resurrectionis Jesu Christi: et gratia magna erat in illis omnibus.
verses.english: And with great power the apostles gave testimony to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus, and great grace was upon them all.

verses.latin: Neque enim quisquam egens erat inter illos. Quotquot enim possessores agrorum aut domorum erant, vendentes, afferebant pretia eorum quæ vendebant,
verses.english: For there was not anyone needy among them, because all who owned land or houses sold them and brought the proceeds of what was sold,

verses.latin: et ponebant ante pedes apostolorum. Dividebatur autem singulis prout cuique opus erat.
verses.english: and laid it at the apostles’ feet. And distribution was made to each as any had need.

verses.latin: Joseph autem, qui dicebatur a Apostolis Barnabas (quod est interpretatum Filius consolationis) Levites, Cyprius genere,
verses.english: Now Joseph, whom the apostles called Barnabas (which means, Son of encouragement), a Levite, a native of Cyprus,

verses.latin: cum haberet agrum, vendidit illum, et attulit pretium, et posuit ante pedes apostolorum.
verses.english: having a field, sold it and brought the money and laid it at the apostles’ feet.

verses.latin: Simon autem Petrus, dixit: Viri fratres, noscite quia de diebus antiquioribus Deus in vobis elegit per os meum audire gentes verbum evangelii, et credere.
verses.english: Then Peter rose up and said, “Brothers, listen. God chose me to preach the Gospel to the Gentiles, so they could hear and believe.”

verses.latin: Et qui cognoscit corda, Deus, testimonium perhibuit, dans illis Spiritum Sanctum, sicut et nobis,
verses.english: And God, who knows the mind and heart of every man, also gave the Holy Spirit to them, just as He did to us,

verses.latin: et nihil separavit inter nos et illos, fide purificans corda eorum.
verses.english: making no distinction between us, since He purified their hearts through faith.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo quid tentatis Deum, inducere jugum super cervices discipulorum, quod neque patres nostri, neque nos portare potuimus?
verses.english: So, why do you now put God to the test, placing a burden on the necks of these disciples which neither we nor our fathers have been able to carry?

verses.latin: Sed per gratiam Domini Jesu Christi credimus salvari, quemadmodum et illi.
verses.english: But we believe it is by the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ that we are saved, as they are.”

verses.latin: Silenuit autem omnis multitudo: et audiebant Barnaban et Paulum narrantes quanta fecisset Deus signa et prodigia in gentibus per eos.
verses.english: And all the assembly of the apostles remained silent. They were listening to Barnabas and Paul as they told of the wonders and signs God had worked through them among the Gentiles.

verses.latin: Et postquam tacuerunt, respondit Jacobus, dicens: Viri fratres, audite me.
verses.english: After they were done speaking, James addressed the assembly, saying, “Brothers, listen to me.

verses.latin: Simon narravit quemadmodum primum Deus visitavit sumere ex gentibus populum nomini suo.
verses.english: Simeon has related how God first showed His concern by gathering a people for his own name out of the Gentiles.

verses.latin: Et huic concordant verba prophetarum, sicut scriptum est:
verses.english: And the words of the prophets agree with this, as it is written:

verses.latin: Post haec revertar, et aedificabo tabernaculum David, quod cecidit: et diruta ejus reaedificabo, et erigam illud:
verses.english: “After this I will return and rebuild the fallen house of David; I will rebuild its ruins and restore it,

verses.latin: ut requirant ceteri hominum Dominum, et omnes gentes, super quas invocatum est nomen meum, dicit Dominus faciens haec.
verses.english: so that the rest of humanity may seek the Lord, including all the Gentiles over whom my name has been proclaimed.”

verses.latin: Notum est a sæculo Deo opus suum.
verses.english: God has shown us this from the beginning of the world.

verses.latin: Propter quod ego judico non inquietandos eos, qui ex gentibus convertuntur ad Deum,
verses.english: Therefore, it is my judgment that we should not make it difficult for those Gentiles who are turning to God,

verses.latin: sed scribere ad eos, ut abstineant se a contaminationibus simulacrorum, et fornicatione, et suffocato, et sanguine.
verses.english: but we should instead write to them to abstain from things polluted by idols, from unlawful marriage, from the meat of strangled animals, and from blood.

verses.latin: Moses enim a diebus antiquis habet in singulis civitatibus qui eum prædicent in synagogis, ubi per omne sabbatum legitur.
verses.english: For from ancient times Moses has had those who proclaim him in every town, as he is read every Sabbath in the synagogues.”

verses.latin: Tunc placuit apostolis et senioribus cum omni ecclesia, eligentes viros de se, et mittens Antiochiam cum Paulo et Barnaba, Judam, qui cognominabatur Barsabas, et Silam, viros primarios in fratribus.
verses.english: Then the apostles and the elders, with the whole church, decided to send men chosen from among them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas. They chose Judas, called Barsabbas, and Silas, leading men among the brothers.

verses.latin: scribentes per manus eorum: Apostoli et seniores fratres, iis qui sunt per Antiochiam, et Syriam, et Ciliciam, fratribus ex gentibus, salutem.
verses.english: They sent the following letter by their hand: “The apostles and the elders, your brothers, to the brothers in Antioch, Syria, and Cilicia, who are Gentiles: Greetings.

verses.latin: Quoniam quidam ex nobis, sine mandato nostro, vobis inquietantes animas vestras, subverterunt, dicentes vos debere circumcidi, et custodire legem: quibus non mandavimus,
verses.english: We have heard that some of us went out from us without our authorization. They troubled your souls with what they said and upset you, telling you that you must be circumcised and keep the law. We gave them no such instructions.

verses.latin: placuit nobis collectis in unum, eligere viros et mittere ad vos cum dilectis nostris Barnaba et Paulo,
verses.english: So we all agreed to choose men to send to you, along with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,

verses.latin: hominibus qui tradiderunt animas suas pro nomine Domini nostri Jesu Christi.
verses.english: men who have risked their lives for the sake of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: Misimus ergo Judam et Silam, qui et ipsi vobis eaedem referent.
verses.english: We have therefore sent Judas and Silas, who will also tell you the same things by word of mouth.

verses.latin: Visum est enim Spiritui Sancto, et nobis, nihil ultra vobis onus imponere quam hæc necessaria:
verses.english: For it has seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us to place no further burden on you than these essential things:

verses.latin: ut abstineatis vos a simulacrorum immolatis, et sanguine, et suffocato, et fornicatione: a quibus custodiendo, bene agetis. Valete.
verses.english: that you abstain from what has been sacrificed to idols, from blood, from the meat of strangled animals, and from unlawful marriage. If you keep yourselves from these things, you will do well. Farewell.”

verses.latin: Ipsi igitur dimissi venientes Antiochiam, et congregata multitudine, tradiderunt epistolam.
verses.english: So they left, went down to Antioch, and gathered the whole assembly. Then they delivered the letter.

verses.latin: Quam cum legissent, gavisi sunt super consolatione.
verses.english: When they read it, they rejoiced over the encouragement it provided.

verses.latin: Judas quoque et Silas, et ipsi cum essent prophetæ, verbo plurimo exhortati sunt fratres, et confirmaverunt.
verses.english: Judas and Silas, being prophets themselves, encouraged the brothers with many words and strengthened them.

verses.latin: Facto autem ibi aliquanto tempore, dimissi sunt cum pace a fratribus ad eos qui miserant illos.
verses.english: After they spent some time there, they were sent off with peace by the brothers to those who had sent them.

verses.latin: Visum est autem Silæ ibi remanere.
verses.english: But Silas decided to remain there.

verses.latin: Paulus autem et Barnabas demorabantur Antiochæ, docentes et evangelizantes cum aliis pluribus verbum Domini.
verses.english: Paul and Barnabas remained in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, along with many others.

verses.latin: Post dies autem aliquot, dixit ad Paulum Barnabas: Revertentes visitemus fratres per universas civitates, in quibus prædicavimus verbum Domini, quomodo se habeant.
verses.english: After some time, Paul said to Barnabas, “Let us go back and visit the brothers in every town where we have preached the word of the Lord, and see how they are doing.”

verses.latin: Barnabas quidem volebat secum assumere et Joannem, qui cognominatur Marcus.
verses.english: Barnabas wanted to take John, called Mark, along with them.

verses.latin: Paulus autem rogabat eum, qui discesserat ab eis de Pamphylia, nec ierat cum eis in opus, ut non susciperent hunc.
verses.english: But Paul didn’t think it was right to take him, because he had deserted them in Pamphylia and hadn’t accompanied them in their work.

verses.latin: Facta est autem dissensio, ita ut discederent ab invicem, et Barnabas quidem, assumpto Marco, navigaret in Cyprum:
verses.english: There was a sharp disagreement, so that they separated from each other, and Barnabas took Mark with him and sailed to Cyprus.

verses.latin: Paulus autem, electo Sila, profectus est, traditus gratiæ Dei a fratribus.
verses.english: Paul chose Silas and left, commended by the brothers to the grace of God.

verses.latin: Perambulabat autem Syriam et Ciliciam, confirmans ecclesias.
verses.english: He traveled through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.

verses.latin: In diebus autem illis, crescente numero discipulorum, factum est murmur Græcorum adversus Hebræos, eo quod despiciebantur in ministerio quotidiano viduæ eorum.
verses.english: Now, in those days, as the number of disciples grew, a complaint arose among the Hellenists against the Hebrews, because their widows were being neglected in the daily distribution.

verses.latin: Convocantes autem duodecim totam multitudinem discipulorum, dixerunt: Non est æquum nos derelinquere verbum Dei, et ministrare mensis.
verses.english: The Twelve summoned the whole group of disciples and said: “It is not right for us to neglect the word of God in order to serve tables.

verses.latin: Quærite ergo, fratres, viros ex vobis bonæ testimonii, septem plenos Spiritu Sancto et sapientia, quos constituamus super hoc negotio.
verses.english: Therefore, brothers, select seven men from among you, of good repute, full of the Holy Spirit and wisdom, whom we may appoint for this task.

verses.latin: Nos vero orationi, et ministerio verbi instantes erimus.
verses.english: But we will devote ourselves to prayer and to the ministry of the word.”

verses.latin: Et placuit sermo iste coram omni multitudine: et elegerunt Stephanum, virum plenum fide et Spiritu Sancto, et Philippum, et Prochorum, et Nicanorem, et Timonem, et Parmenam, et Nicolaum advenam Antiochenum:
verses.english: This proposal pleased the whole group, and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and the Holy Spirit, along with Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolaus, a proselyte from Antioch.

verses.latin: hos constituerunt ante conspectum Apostolorum: et orantes, imposuerunt eis manus.
verses.english: These they presented to the apostles, and after they prayed, they laid their hands on them.

verses.latin: Et verbum Dei crescebat, et multiplicabatur numerus discipulorum in Jerusalem nimis: magna etiam multitudo sacerdotum obediebat fidei.
verses.english: And the word of God continued to spread. The number of the disciples in Jerusalem increased greatly, and a great many of the priests were becoming obedient to the faith.

verses.latin: Stephanus autem, plenus gratia et fortitudine, faciebat prodigia et signa magna in populo.
verses.english: Now Stephen, full of grace and power, was working great wonders and signs among the people.

verses.latin: Surrexerunt autem quidam de synagoga, quæ dicitur Libertinorum, et Cyrenensium, et Alexandrinorum, et eorum qui erant a Cilicia et Asia, disputantes cum Stephano.
verses.english: But some of those who belonged to the Synagogue of the Freedmen (as it was called), and of the Cyrenians, and of the Alexandrians, and those from Cilicia and Asia, rose up and disputed with Stephen.

verses.latin: Et non poterant resistere sapientiæ, et Spiritui, qui loquebatur.
verses.english: And they could not withstand the wisdom and the Spirit with which he was speaking.

verses.latin: Tunc summiserunt viros, qui dicerent se audivisse eum dicentem verba blasphemiæ in Moysen et Deum.
verses.english: Then they secretly instigated men to say, “We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God.”

verses.latin: Commoveruntque plebem, et seniores, et scribas: et concurrentes rapuerunt eum, et adduxerunt in concilium.
verses.english: And they stirred up the people, the elders, and the scribes; and they came upon him and seized him and brought him before the council.

verses.latin: Et statuerunt falsos testes, qui dicerent: Homo iste non cessat loqui verba adversus locum sanctum et legem:
verses.english: They set up false witnesses who said, “This man never stops speaking against this holy place and the law.

verses.latin: audivimus enim eum dicentem quoniam Jesus Nazarenus hic destruet locum istum, et mutabit consuetudines quas tradidit nobis Moyses.
verses.english: For we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place and will change the customs that Moses delivered to us.”

verses.latin: Et intuentes eum omnes qui sedebant in concilio, viderunt faciem ejus tamquam faciem angeli.
verses.english: And gazing at him, all who sat in the council saw that his face was like the face of an angel.

verses.latin: Dixit autem princeps sacerdotum: Si haec ita se habent?
verses.english: The high priest then said: “Are these things so?”

verses.latin: Qui ait: Viri fratres et patres, audite. Deus gloriae apparuit patri nostro Abrahae cum esset in Mesopotamia, prius quam moraretur in Charran.
verses.english: And Stephen said: "Brothers and fathers, listen. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham while he was in Mesopotamia, before he went to live in Charran.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eum: Exi de terra tua et de cognatione tua, et veni in terram quam monstravero tibi.
verses.english: And God said to him: 'Leave your land and your family, and come to the land that I will show you.'

verses.latin: Tunc exiit de terra Chaldaeorum, et habitavit in Charran. Et inde, postquam mortuus est pater ejus, transtulit illum in terram istam, in qua nunc vos habitatis.
verses.english: Then Abraham went out from the land of the Chaldeans, and lived in Charran. And from there, after his father died, God brought him into this land, where you now live.

verses.latin: Et non dedit illi haereditatem in ea, nec pedis tantum: sed repromisit dare illi eam in possessionem, et semini ejus post ipsum, cum non habebat filium.
verses.english: And God gave him no inheritance in it, not even a foot of land. But God promised to give it to him as a possession, and to his descendants after him, even though Abraham had no son then.

verses.latin: Locutus est autem Deus: Quia erit semen ejus peregrinum in terra aliena, et servitutem patient, et male tractabunt eos annis quadringentis:
verses.english: And God spoke: 'His descendants will be strangers in a foreign land, and they will be enslaved and mistreated for four hundred years.'

verses.latin: et gentem cui servient, ego judicabo, dixit Deus: et post haec exibunt, et servient mihi in loco isto.
verses.english: 'But I will judge the nation that they will serve,' God said. 'And after that, they will come out and serve Me in this place.'

verses.latin: Et dedit illi testamentum circumcisionis: et sic genuit Isaac, et circumcidit eum die octavo: et Isaac, Jacob: et Jacob, duodecim patriarchas.
verses.english: And God gave Abraham the covenant of circumcision. And so Abraham fathered Isaac, and Abraham circumcised Isaac on the eighth day. And Isaac fathered Jacob, and Jacob fathered the twelve patriarchs.

verses.latin: Et patriarchae, aemulantes, Joseph vendiderunt in Aegyptum: et erat Deus cum illo,
verses.english: And the patriarchs, jealous of Joseph, sold him into Egypt, but God was with him,

verses.latin: et eripuit eum ex omnibus tribulationibus ejus: et dedit ei gratiam et sapientiam in conspectu Pharaonis regis Aegypti: et constituit eum praepositum super Aegyptum et totam domum suam.
verses.english: and rescued him from all his tribulations. And God gave Joseph favor and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh, king of Egypt. And Pharaoh made Joseph governor over Egypt and over all his household.

verses.latin: Venit autem fames in universam Aegyptum, et Chanaan, et tribulatio magna: et non inveniebant cibos patres nostri.
verses.english: Now a famine came upon all of Egypt and Canaan, and there was great hardship, and our fathers could not find food.

verses.latin: Cum audisset autem Jacob esse frumentum in Aegypto, misit patres nostros primum.
verses.english: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent our fathers there first.

verses.latin: Et in secundo cognitus est Joseph a fratribus suis, et manifestatum est Pharaoni genus Joseph.
verses.english: And on the second trip, Joseph was recognized by his brothers, and Joseph's family was revealed to Pharaoh.

verses.latin: Mittens autem Joseph, accersivit Jacob patrem suum, et omnem cognationem in septuaginta et quinque animas.
verses.english: So Joseph sent for his father Jacob, and for his whole family, seventy-five people in all.

verses.latin: Descendit itaque Jacob in Aegyptum: et mortuus est ipse, et patres nostri.
verses.english: So Jacob went down to Egypt, and he died there, as did our fathers.

verses.latin: Et translati sunt in Sichem, et positi sunt in sepulchro, quod emit Abraham pretio argenti a filiis Hemor filii Sichem.
verses.english: And they were brought back to Shechem, and placed in the tomb that Abraham had bought for a sum of silver from the sons of Hamor, the son of Shechem.

verses.latin: Cum autem appropinquasset tempus promissionis, quam confessus est Deus Abrahae, crevit populus, et multiplicatus est in Aegypto,
verses.english: But as the time drew near for the fulfillment of the promise that God had made to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,

verses.latin: quoadusque surrexit alius rex in Aegypto, qui nesciebat Joseph.
verses.english: until another king arose in Egypt, who did not know Joseph.

verses.latin: Hic circumveniens genus nostrum, moleste tractavit patres nostros, ut exponerentur infantes suos, ne conservarentur.
verses.english: This king, scheming against our race, mistreated our fathers, and forced them to abandon their infants, so that they would not be kept alive.

verses.latin: In quo tempore natus est Moyses, et fuit gratus Deo: qui nutritus est tribus mensibus in domo patris sui.
verses.english: It was at this time that Moses was born, and he was pleasing to God. And Moses was nourished for three months in his father's house.

verses.latin: Exposito autem illo, sustulit eum filia Pharaonis, et nutrivit eum sibi in filium.
verses.english: But when Moses was abandoned, Pharaoh's daughter took him up and raised him as her own son.

verses.latin: Et eruditus est Moyses omni sapientia Aegyptiorum: et erat potens in verbis et in operibus suis.
verses.english: And Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and he was powerful in his words and in his deeds.

verses.latin: Cum autem impleretur ei quadraginta annorum tempus, ascendit in cor ejus visitare fratres suos filios Israel.
verses.english: Now when Moses was forty years old, he decided to visit his brothers, the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Et cum vidisset quemdam injuriam patientem, defendit eum, et fecit vindictam ei, qui contristabatur, percusso Aegyptio.
verses.english: And when he saw one of them being wronged, Moses defended him, and avenged the one who was being oppressed by striking down the Egyptian.

verses.latin: Existimabat autem intelligere fratres, quod Deus per manum ipsius daret illis salutem: at illi non intellexerunt.
verses.english: Moses thought that his brothers would understand that God was giving them salvation by his hand, but they did not understand.

verses.latin: Sequenti vero die, apparuit illis rixantibus: et reconciliabat eos in pace, dicens: Viri, fratres estis: ut quid nocetis invicem?
verses.english: And on the next day Moses appeared to them as they were fighting, and he tried to reconcile them in peace, saying: 'Men, you are brothers! Why do you wrong each other?'

verses.latin: Qui autem laedebat proximum, repulit eum, dicens: Quis te constituit principem et judicem super nos?
verses.english: But the one who was wronging his neighbor pushed him away, saying: 'Who made you a ruler and a judge over us?'

verses.latin: Numquid me vis interficere, quemadmodum interfectum heri Aegyptium?
verses.english: 'Do you want to kill me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?'

verses.latin: Fugit autem Moyses in verbo isto: et factus est peregrinus in terra Madian, ubi genuit filios duos.
verses.english: Then Moses fled at this word, and became a stranger in the land of Midian, where he fathered two sons.

verses.latin: Et cum implerentur anni quadraginta, apparuit illi in deserto montis Sina Angelus in flamma ignis rubi.
verses.english: And when forty years were completed, an Angel appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in a flame of fire from a bush.

verses.latin: Moyses autem videns, mirabatur visum. Et accedente eo ut consideraret, facta est vox Domini ad illum:
verses.english: When Moses saw the vision, he marveled at it. And as he approached to examine it, the voice of the Lord came to him,

verses.latin: Ego Deus patrum tuorum, Deus Abraham, Deus Isaac, et Deus Jacob. Tremefactus autem Moyses, non audebat considerare.
verses.english: 'I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.' But Moses, trembling, did not dare to consider it.

verses.latin: Dixit autem illi Dominus: Solve calceamentum pedum tuorum: locus enim in quo stas, terra sancta est.
verses.english: And the Lord said to him: 'Take off the sandals from your feet, for the place where you are standing is holy ground.'

verses.latin: Videns vidi afflictionem populi mei, qui est in Aegypto, et gemitum eorum audivi, et descendi liberare eos. Et nunc veni, et mittam te in Aegyptum.
verses.english: 'I have surely seen the affliction of My people who are in Egypt, and I have heard their groaning, and I have come down to deliver them. And now come, I will send you to Egypt.'

verses.latin: Hunc Moysen, quem negaverunt, dicentes: Quis te constituit principem et judicem? hunc Deus principem et redemptorem misit cum manu angeli, qui apparuit illi in rubo.
verses.english: This Moses, whom they rejected, saying: 'Who made you a ruler and a judge?' God sent Moses as both a ruler and a redeemer by the hand of the Angel who appeared to him in the bush.

verses.latin: Hic eduxit illos faciens prodigia et signa in terra Aegypti, et in rubro mari, et in deserto annis quadraginta.
verses.english: Moses led them out, doing wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, and in the Red Sea, and in the wilderness for forty years.

verses.latin: Hic est Moyses, qui dixit filiis Israel: Prophetam vobis suscitabit Deus de fratribus vestris, tamquam me.
verses.english: This is that Moses who said to the sons of Israel: 'God will raise up for you a prophet from among your brothers, just like me.'

verses.latin: Hic est, qui fuit in ecclesia in solitudine cum angelo, qui loquebatur ei in monte Sina, et cum patribus nostris: qui accepit verba vitae dare nobis.
verses.english: This is the Moses who was in the assembly in the wilderness with the Angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our fathers; Moses received living words to give to us.

verses.latin: Cui noluerunt obedire patres nostri: sed repulerunt, et aversati sunt cordibus suis in Aegyptum,
verses.english: But our fathers would not obey Moses. They rejected him, and in their hearts they turned back to Egypt,

verses.latin: dicentes ad Aaron: Fac nobis deos, qui praecedant nos: Moyses enim hic, qui eduxit nos de terra Aegypti, nescimus quid ei factum sit.
verses.english: saying to Aaron: 'Make us gods to go before us, for as for this Moses, who led us out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.'

verses.latin: Et vitulum fecerunt in diebus illis, et obtulerunt hostiam simulacro, et laetabantur in operibus manuum suarum.
verses.english: And they made a calf in those days, and offered a sacrifice to the idol, and were rejoicing in the works of their own hands.

verses.latin: Converterunt autem Deus, et tradidit eos servire militiae caeli, sicut scriptum est in libro Prophetarum: Numquid victimas et hostias mihi obtulistis annis quadraginta in deserto, domus Israel?
verses.english: But God turned away from them and gave them over to serve the host of heaven, as it is written in the book of the prophets: 'Did you offer Me sacrifices and offerings during the forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?'

verses.latin: Et suscepistis tabernaculum Moloch, et sidus Dei vestri Remphan, figuras quas fecistis adorare eas: et transferam vos trans Babylonem.
verses.english: 'And you took up the tent of Moloch and the star of your god Remphan, the images that you made to worship. So I will send you into exile beyond Babylon.'

verses.latin: Tabernaculum testimonii fuit cum patribus nostris in deserto, sicut disposuit, qui loquebatur ad Moysen, ut faceret illud secundum formam quam viderat.
verses.english: Our fathers had the tabernacle of testimony in the wilderness, as He who spoke to Moses directed, so that Moses should make it according to the pattern he had seen.

verses.latin: Quod et introduxerunt, suscipientes patres nostri cum Jesu in possessionem gentium, quas expulit Deus a facie patrum nostrorum, usque in diebus David,
verses.english: Our fathers, in turn, brought it in with Joshua when they took possession of the land of the Gentiles, whom God drove out before our fathers, until the days of David.

verses.latin: qui invenit gratiam ante Deum, et petiit ut inveniret tabernaculum Deo Jacob.
verses.english: David found favor in the sight of God, and he asked to find a dwelling place for the God of Jacob.

verses.latin: Salomon autem aedificavit illi domum.
verses.english: But it was Solomon who built a house for God.

verses.latin: Sed Altissimus non in manu factis habitat, sicut propheta dicit:
verses.english: However, the Most High does not dwell in buildings made by hands, as the prophet says:

verses.latin: Caelum mihi sedes est: terra autem scabellum pedum meorum. Quam domum aedificabitis mihi? dicit Dominus: aut quis locus requietionis meae?
verses.english: 'Heaven is My throne, and earth is the footstool of My feet. What house will you build for Me?' says the Lord, 'or what is the place of My rest?'

verses.latin: Nonne manus mea fecit haec omnia?
verses.english: 'Has not My hand made all these things?'

verses.latin: Dura cervice, et incircumcisi corde et auribus, vos semper resistitis Spiritui Sancto: sicut patres vestri, et vos.
verses.english: You stiff-necked people, uncircumcised in heart and ears, you always resist the Holy Spirit; as your fathers did, so do you.

verses.latin: Quem prophetarum non sunt persecuti patres vestri? Et occiderunt eos qui praenuntiabant de adventu Justi, cujus vos nunc proditores et homicidae fuistis:
verses.english: Which of the prophets did your fathers not persecute? And they killed those who foretold the coming of the Righteous One, of whom you have now become the betrayers and murderers.

verses.latin: qui accepistis legem in dispositione angelorum, et non custodistis.
verses.english: You received the law as delivered by angels, and you did not keep it.

verses.latin: Haec audientes, discindebantur cordibus suis, et stridebant dentibus in eum.
verses.english: Now when they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed their teeth at him.

verses.latin: Cum autem esset plenus Spiritu Sancto, intendens in caelum, vidit gloriam Dei, et Jesum stantem a dextris Dei.
verses.english: But Stephen, full of the Holy Spirit, looked intently into the universe, and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Ecce video caelos apertos, et Filium hominis stantem a dextris Dei.
verses.english: And Stephen said: "Behold, I see the sky opened, and the Son of man standing at the right hand of God."

verses.latin: Exclamantes autem voce magna, continuerunt aures suas, et impetum fecerunt unanimiter in eum.
verses.english: Then they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and rushed at him together,

verses.latin: et ejicientes eum extra civitatem, lapidabant. Et testes deposuerunt vestimenta sua secus pedes adolescentis, qui vocabatur Saulus.
verses.english: and they cast him out of the city and began to stone him. And the witnesses laid down their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul.

verses.latin: Et lapidabant Stephanum invocantem, et dicentem: Domine Jesu, suscipe spiritum meum.
verses.english: And they were stoning Stephen as he called out, saying, "Lord Jesus, receive my spirit."

verses.latin: Positis autem genibus, clamavit voce magna, dicens: Domine, ne statuas illis hoc peccatum. Et cum hoc dixisset, obdormivit in Domino.
verses.english: And he knelt down and cried out with a loud voice, saying, "Lord, do not hold this sin against them." And when he had said this, he fell asleep in the Lord.

verses.latin: Saulus autem probabat adsumptionem eius. Facta est autem in illa die persecutio magna in ecclesia, quae erat in Ierosolymis, et omnes dispersi sunt per regiones Iudaeae et Samariae praeter apostolos.
verses.english: Saul approved of the killing of Stephen. A great persecution began against the Church in Jerusalem that very day, and all the Christians were scattered throughout Judea and Samaria—except for the apostles, who stayed in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Curaverunt autem Stephanum viri timorati, et fecerunt ei planctum magnum.
verses.english: Some devout men buried Stephen, and they mourned for him.

verses.latin: Saulus autem vastabat ecclesiam, per domos intrans, et trahens viros ac mulieres tradidit eos in carcerem.
verses.english: Saul ravaged the Church, entering house after house, dragging off both men and women, and putting them in prison.

verses.latin: Igitur qui dispersi fuerant, perambulaverunt evangelizantes verbum Dei.
verses.english: So those who had been scattered went about preaching the good news of God.

verses.latin: Philippus autem descendens in civitatem Samariae, praedicabat illis Christum.
verses.english: Philip went down to the city of Samaria and preached Christ to them.

verses.latin: Intendebant autem turbae his quae a Philippo dicebantur, unianimiter audientes et videntes signa quae faciebat.
verses.english: The crowds paid close attention to what Philip said, because they were united in listening to him and seeing the miracles that he was performing.

verses.latin: Multi enim eorum qui habebant spiritus immundos, clamantes voce magna exiebant. Multi autem paralytici et claudi curati sunt.
verses.english: For unclean spirits, crying out loudly, came out of many who were possessed by them, and many who were paralyzed or lame were cured.

verses.latin: Factum est ergo gaudium magnum in illa civitate.
verses.english: So there was great joy in that city.

verses.latin: Vir autem quidam, nomine Simon, qui ante fuerat in civitate magus, seducens gentem Samariae, dicens se esse aliquem magnum,
verses.english: Now a certain man named Simon had previously practiced magic in the city of Samaria and had amazed the Samaritan people. He claimed to be someone great,

verses.latin: cui auscultabant omnes a minimo usque ad maximum, dicentes: Hic est virtus Dei, quae vocatur magna.
verses.english: and all the people, from the least to the greatest, listened to him, saying, “This man is the power of God, which is called ‘the Great Power.’”

verses.latin: Attendebant autem ei propter quod multo tempore magiis suis dementasset eos.
verses.english: They were devoted to him because for a long time he had amazed them with his magic.

verses.latin: Cum vero credidissent Philippo evangelizanti de regno Dei, et nomini Jesu Christi, baptizabantur viri ac mulieres.
verses.english: But when they believed Philip as he proclaimed the good news about the Kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

verses.latin: Tunc Simon et ipse credidit: et baptizatus, erat in eo. Videns virtutes et signa magna fieri, stupens, admirabatur.
verses.english: Even Simon himself believed. And after he was baptized, he stayed close to Philip. When he saw the signs and great miracles that were being performed, he was amazed.

verses.latin: Cum autem audissent apostoli qui erant in Ierosolymis, quod recepisset Samaria verbum Dei, miserunt ad illos Petrum et Joannem.
verses.english: Now when the apostles in Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them.

verses.latin: Qui cum venissent, oraverunt pro ipsis ut acciperent Spiritum Sanctum.
verses.english: When they arrived, they prayed that the Samaritans might receive the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: Nondum enim illis acciderat, sed tantum baptizati erant in nomine Domini Jesu.
verses.english: The Spirit had not yet come down on any of them, they had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

verses.latin: Tunc imponentes manus super illos, accipiebant Spiritum Sanctum.
verses.english: Then Peter and John placed their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: Cum vidisset autem Simon, quia per impositionem manus apostolorum daretur Spiritus Sanctus, obtulit eis pecuniam,
verses.english: When Simon saw that the Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles’ hands, he offered them money,

verses.latin: dicens: Date et mihi hanc potestatem, ut cuicumque imposuero manus, accipiat Spiritum Sanctum.
verses.english: saying, “Give me this power also, so that anyone on whom I lay my hands may receive the Holy Spirit.”

verses.latin: Petrus autem dixit ad eum: Pecunia tua sit tecum in perditionem, quoniam existimasti donum Dei pecunia possideri.
verses.english: But Peter replied, “May your money perish with you, because you thought you could buy the gift of God with money!

verses.latin: Non est tibi pars, neque sors in sermone isto. Cor enim tuum non est rectum coram Deo.
verses.english: You have no part or share in this matter, because your heart is not right before God.

verses.latin: Paenitentiam itaque age ab hac nequitia tua, et roga Deum, si forte remittatur tibi haec cogitatio cordis tui.
verses.english: Repent of this wickedness of yours, and pray to the Lord that, if possible, your heart’s intent may be forgiven.

verses.latin: In felle enim amaritudinis, et in vinculo iniquitatis video te esse.
verses.english: For I see that you are in the gall of bitterness and in the bondage of iniquity.”

verses.latin: Respondens autem Simon, dixit: Precamini pro me ad Dominum, ut nihil horum, quae dixistis, veniat super me.
verses.english: Then Simon answered, “Pray to the Lord for me, that nothing of what you have said may happen to me.”

verses.latin: Igitur illi protestati et locuti verbum Domini, revertebantur in Jerusalem, et multis regionibus Samaritae evangelizabant.
verses.english: So when they had testified and proclaimed the word of the Lord, they returned to Jerusalem, preaching the good news in many villages of the Samaritans.

verses.latin: Angelus autem Domini locutus est ad Philippum, dicens: Surge, et vade contra meridianum, ad viam quae descendit ab Ierusalem in Gazam: haec est deserta.
verses.english: Then an angel of the Lord said to Philip, “Get up and go south to the road that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza.” (This road is desolate.)

verses.latin: Et surgens abiit. Et ecce vir Aethiops, eunuchus, potens Candacis reginae Aethiopum, qui erat super omnes gazas eius, venerat adorare in Ierusalem:
verses.english: So he got up and went. There he met an Ethiopian eunuch, a high official of Candace, the queen of the Ethiopians, who was in charge of her entire treasury. This man had come to Jerusalem to worship,

verses.latin: et revertebatur sedens super currum suum, et legens Esaiam prophetam.
verses.english: and he was returning home; he was sitting in his chariot and reading the prophet Isaiah.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Spiritus Philippo: Accede, et coniungere currui isti.
verses.english: Then the Spirit said to Philip, “Go over and join this chariot.”

verses.latin: Currens autem Philippus, audivit eum legentem Esaiam prophetam. Et dixit: Putasne intellegis quae legis?
verses.english: So Philip ran up to him and heard him reading the prophet Isaiah. He asked, “Do you understand what you are reading?”

verses.latin: Qui ait: Et quomodo possum, si non aliquis ostenderit mihi? Et rogavit Philippum ut ascenderet, et sederet secum.
verses.english: He replied, “How can I, unless someone guides me?” And he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.

verses.latin: Sermo autem quem legebat, erat hic: Sicut ovis ad occisionem ductus est, et sicut agnus coram tondente se, sine voce, sic non aperuit os suum.
verses.english: Now the passage of Scripture that he was reading was this: “He was led like a sheep to the slaughter, and as a lamb before its shearer is silent, so he did not open his mouth.

verses.latin: In humilitate iudicium eius sublata est. Generationem eius quis enarrabit? Quoniam tollitur de terra vita eius.
verses.english: In his humiliation justice was denied him. Who will tell of his generation? For his life is taken away from the earth.”

verses.latin: Respondens autem eunuchus Philippo, dixit: Obsecro te, de quo propheta dicit hoc? de se, an de alio aliquo?
verses.english: The eunuch replied to Philip, “Please tell me, who is the prophet talking about? Is it about himself or about someone else?”

verses.latin: Aperiens autem Philippus os suum, et incipiens a scriptura ista, evangelizavit illi Jesum.
verses.english: Then Philip opened his mouth, and beginning with this passage, he preached the good news about Jesus to him.

verses.latin: Et dum irent per viam, venerunt ad aquam: et dixit eunuchus: Ecce aqua: quid prohibet me baptizari?
verses.english: And as they were going along the road, they came to some water; and the eunuch said, “Look, here is water! What prevents me from being baptized?”

verses.latin: Dixit autem Philippus: Si credis ex toto corde, licet. Et respondens ait: Credo filium Dei esse Jesum Christum.
verses.english: And Philip said, “If you believe with all your heart, you may.” And he replied, “I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.”

verses.latin: Et iussit stare currum: et descenderunt ambo in aquam, Philippus et eunuchus, et baptizavit eum.
verses.english: Then he ordered the chariot to stop, and both of them, Philip and the eunuch, went down into the water, and Philip baptized him.

verses.latin: Cum autem ascendissent de aqua, Spiritus Domini rapuit Philippum, et amplius non vidit eum eunuchus. Ibat enim viam suam gaudens.
verses.english: When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord suddenly took Philip away, and the eunuch did not see him again, but went on his way rejoicing.

verses.latin: Philippus autem inventus est in Azoto: et pertransiens evangelizabat omnibus civitatibus, donec veniret Caesaream.
verses.english: But Philip found himself at Azotus, and as he passed through the region, he proclaimed the good news in all the cities until he came to Caesarea.

verses.latin: Saulus autem adhuc spirans minarum et caedis in discipulos Domini, accessit ad principem sacerdotum,
verses.english: Meanwhile, Saul was still threatening the Lord’s disciples. He wanted to kill them, so he went to the high priest,

verses.latin: et petiit ab eo epistulas ad Damascum ad synagogas: ut si quos invenisset hujus viæ, viros ac mulieres, vinctos perduceret in Jerusalem.
verses.english: and asked for letters to the synagogues in Damascus. He wanted to arrest any men or women who followed the Way of Jesus, so that he could bring them to Jerusalem in chains.

verses.latin: Et cum iter faceret, contigit eum, adpropinquare Damasco: et subito circumfulsit eum lux de caelo.
verses.english: As he was traveling and nearing Damascus, suddenly a light shone from the sky all around him.

verses.latin: Et cadens in terram, audivit vocem dicentem sibi: Saule, Saule, quid me persequeris?
verses.english: He fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to him, “Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?”

verses.latin: Qui dixit: Quis es Domine? Et ille: Ego sum Jesus quem tu persequeris.
verses.english: Saul asked, “Who are you, Lord?” The voice replied, “I am Jesus, the one you are persecuting.

verses.latin: Sed surge, et intra in civitatem, et ibi dicetur tibi quid te oporteat facere.
verses.english: Now get up and go into the city, where you will be told what you must do.”

verses.latin: Viri autem, qui comitabantur cum eo, stabant muti, audientes quidem vocem, neminem autem videntes.
verses.english: The men traveling with him stood speechless. They heard the voice, but they could not see anyone.

verses.latin: Surrexit autem Saulus de terra, apertisque oculis, nihil videbat. Ad manus autem trahentes eum, introduxerunt Damascum.
verses.english: Saul got up from the ground, and when he opened his eyes, he could see nothing. So they took him by the hand and led him into Damascus.

verses.latin: Et erat triduum non videns, et non comedit neque bibit.
verses.english: He could not see for three days, and he neither ate nor drank.

verses.latin: Erat autem discipulus quidam Damasci, nomine Ananias: et dixit ad eum Dominus in visu: Anania. At ille ait: Adsum, Domine.
verses.english: In Damascus there was a disciple named Ananias. The Lord spoke to him in a vision, saying, “Ananias.” Ananias answered, “Here I am, Lord.”

verses.latin: Dominus autem ad eum: Surge, et vade in vicum qui vocatur Rectus: et quaere in domo Judæ, Saulum nomine Tarsensem: ecce enim orat.
verses.english: The Lord said to him, “Get up and go to the street called Straight. Ask at the house of Judas for a man from Tarsus named Saul. He is praying,

verses.latin: et vidit virum Ananiam nomine, introëuntem, et imponentem sibi manus, ut visum faciat.
verses.english: and he has seen a man named Ananias coming in and laying his hands on him so that he can see again.”

verses.latin: Respondit autem Ananias: Domine, audivi a multis de viro hoc, quanta mala fecerit sanctis tuis in Jerusalem:
verses.english: Ananias answered, “Lord, I have heard many reports about this man and all the harm he has done to your holy people in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: et hic habet potestatem a principibus sacerdotum alligandi omnes qui invocant nomen tuum.
verses.english: He has received authority from the chief priests to arrest everyone who calls on your name.”

verses.latin: Dixit autem ad eum Dominus: Vade, quoniam vas electionis est mihi iste, ut portet nomen meum coram gentibus, et regibus, et filiis Israël.
verses.english: But the Lord said to him, “Go, for this man is my chosen instrument to proclaim my name to the Gentiles and their kings and to the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Ego enim ostendam illi quanta oporteat eum pro nomine meo pati.
verses.english: I will show him how much he must suffer for my name.”

verses.latin: Abiit autem Ananias, et introivit in domum: et mittens super illum manus, dixit: Saule frater, Dominus misit me, Jesus, qui apparuit tibi in via qua veniebas: ut videas, et implearis Spiritu Sancto.
verses.english: Then Ananias went to the house and entered it. He placed his hands on Saul and said, “Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, who appeared to you on the road as you were coming here, has sent me so that you may see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”

verses.latin: Et confestim ceciderunt ab oculis ejus tamquam squamæ: et visum recuperavit. Et surgens baptizatus est.
verses.english: Immediately something like scales fell from Saul’s eyes, and he could see again. He got up and was baptized,

verses.latin: Et cum accepisset cibum, confortatus est.  Fuit autem cum discipulis qui erant Damasci, per dies aliquot.
verses.english: and after taking some food, he regained his strength. Saul stayed with the disciples in Damascus for some days.

verses.latin: Et continuo in synagogis prædicabat Jesum, quoniam hic est Filius Dei.
verses.english: Immediately he began to preach in the synagogues that Jesus is the Son of God.

verses.latin: Stupebant autem omnes qui audiebant, et dicebant: Nonne hic est qui expugnabat in Jerusalem eos qui invocabant nomen istud? et huc venit ut vinctos illos duceret ad principes sacerdotum.
