verses.english: All those who heard him were astonished and asked, “Isn’t this the man who raised havoc in Jerusalem among those who call on this name? And hasn’t he come here to take them as prisoners to the chief priests?”

verses.latin: Saulus autem magis confortabatur, et confundebat Judæos qui habitabant Damasci, probans quoniam hic est Christus.
verses.english: Yet Saul grew more and more powerful and baffled the Jews living in Damascus by proving that Jesus is the Messiah.

verses.latin: Cum autem implerentur dies multi, consilium fecerunt Judæi ut eum interficerent.
verses.english: After many days had passed, the Jews plotted to kill him,

verses.latin: Notitiæ autem factæ sunt Saulo insidiæ eorum. Custodiebant autem portas die ac nocte, ut eum interficerent.
verses.english: but Saul learned of their plan. They were watching the city gates day and night in order to kill him.

verses.latin: Accipientes autem eum discipuli nocte, dimiserunt eum per murum, demittentes in sporta.
verses.english: But his followers helped him escape during the night by lowering him in a basket through an opening in the wall.

verses.latin: Cum autem venisset Saulus in Jerusalem, tentabat se conjungere discipulis: et non credebant ei, quod esset discipulus.
verses.english: When Saul came to Jerusalem, he tried to join the disciples, but they were all afraid of him, not believing that he really was a disciple.

verses.latin: Barnabas autem assumens eum, adduxit ad apostolos: et narravit illis quomodo in via vidisset Dominum, et quia locutus est ei, et quomodo in Damasco fiducialiter egit in nomine Jesu.
verses.english: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles. He told them how Saul on his journey had seen the Lord and that the Lord had spoken to him, and how in Damascus he had preached fearlessly in the name of Jesus.

verses.latin: Et erat cum illis intrans et exiens in Jerusalem, et fiducialiter agens in nomine Domini.
verses.english: So Saul stayed with them and moved about freely in Jerusalem, speaking boldly in the name of the Lord.

verses.latin: Loquebatur autem, et disputabat ad Græcos: illi autem quærebant interficere eum.
verses.english: He talked and debated with the Hellenists, but they tried to kill him.

verses.latin: Quod cum sensissent fratres, deduxerunt eum Caesaream, et dimiserunt Tarsum.
verses.english: When the believers learned of this, they took him down to Caesarea and sent him off to Tarsus.

verses.latin: Ecclesia quidem per totam Judæam, et Galilæam, et Samariam, habebat pacem, ædificabatur, et ambulabat in timore Domini, et consolatione Sancti Spiritus replebatur.
verses.english: Then the church throughout Judea, Galilee and Samaria enjoyed a time of peace and was strengthened. Living in the fear of the Lord and encouraged by the Holy Spirit, it increased in numbers.

verses.latin: Factum est autem Petrum, dum pertransiret universos, devenire et ad sanctos qui habitabant Lyddæ.
verses.english: As Peter traveled about the country, he went to visit the Lord’s people who lived in Lydda.

verses.latin: Invenit autem ibi hominem quendam, nomine Æneam, ab annis octo jacientem in grabato, qui erat paralyticus.
verses.english: There he found a man named Aeneas, who was paralyzed and had been bedridden for eight years.

verses.latin: Et ait illi Petrus: Ænea, sanat te Jesus Christus: surge, et sterne tibi. Et confestim surrexit.
verses.english: Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you. Get up and roll up your mat.” Immediately Aeneas got up,

verses.latin: Et viderunt eum omnes qui habitabant Lyddæ et Saron: qui conversi sunt ad Dominum.
verses.english: and all those who lived in Lydda and Sharon saw him. And many turned to the Lord.

verses.latin: In Joppe autem erat discipula quædam, nomine Tabitha, quæ interpretatur Dorcas: hæc erat plena operibus bonis, et eleemosynis quas faciebat.
verses.english: In Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha (which, when translated, is Dorcas), who was always doing good and helping the poor.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in diebus illis, ut infirmata, moreretur. Quam cum lavissent, posuerunt eam in cenaculo.
verses.english: About that time she became sick and died, and her body was washed and placed in an upstairs room.

verses.latin: Cum autem audissent discipuli, quod Petrus esset in Lydda, miserunt duos viros ad eum, rogantes: Ne moreris venire usque ad nos.
verses.english: Lydda was near Joppa; so when the disciples heard that Peter was in Lydda, they sent two men to him and urged him, “Please come at once!”

verses.latin: Exsurgens autem Petrus, abiit cum illis. Et cum venisset, duxerunt illum in cenaculum: et circumsteterunt illum omnes viduæ, flentes, et ostendentes tunicas et vestes, quas faciebat Dorcas, dum cum illis erat.
verses.english: Peter went with them, and when he arrived, he was taken upstairs to the room. All the widows stood around him, crying and showing him the robes and other clothing that Dorcas had made while she was still with them.

verses.latin: Ejectis autem omnibus foras, Petrus ponens genua, oravit: et conversus ad corpus, dixit: Tabitha, surge. Illa autem aperuit oculos suos: et videns Petrum, resedit.
verses.english: Peter sent them all out of the room; then he got down on his knees and prayed. Turning toward the dead woman, he said, “Tabitha, get up.” She opened her eyes, and seeing Peter, she sat up.

verses.latin: Et dedit illi manum, et erexit eam. Et cum vocasset sanctos et viduas, præsentavit eam vivam.
verses.english: He gave her his hand and helped her to her feet. Then he called the believers and the widows and presented her to them alive.

verses.latin: Notum autem factum est per universam Joppen, et crediderunt multi in Domino.
verses.english: This became known all over Joppa, and many people believed in the Lord.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, quod mansit dies multos in Joppe, apud Simonem quendam coriarium.
verses.english: Peter stayed in Joppa for some time with a tanner named Simon.

verses.latin: Vir autem quidam erat in Caesarea, nomine Cornelius, centurio de cohorte quae dicitur Italica,
verses.english: There was a certain man in Caesarea, whose name was Cornelius, a centurion of the cohort which is called the Italian,

verses.latin: religiosus et timens Deum cum omni domo sua, faciens eleemosynas multas plebi, et deprecans Deum semper:
verses.english: a religious man, and one that feared God with all his house, giving much alms to the people, and always praying to God.

verses.latin: is vidit in visione manifeste, quasi hora nona diei, angelum Dei introeuntem ad se, et dicentem sibi: Corneli.
verses.english: This man saw in a vision manifestly, about the ninth hour of the day, an angel of God coming in to him, and saying to him: Cornelius.

verses.latin: Qui cum aspexisset eum, timore concussus, dixit: Quid est, Domine?
verses.english: And he, beholding him, being seized with fear, said: What is it, Lord?

verses.latin: Qui dixit ei: Orationes tuæ et eleemosynæ tuæ ascenderunt in memoriam in conspectu Dei.
verses.english: And he said to him: Thy prayers and thy alms are ascended for a memorial in the sight of God.

verses.latin: Et nunc mitte viros in Joppen, et accersi Simonem quemdam, qui cognominatur Petrus:
verses.english: And now send men to Joppe, and call for one Simon who is surnamed Peter:

verses.latin: hic hospitatur apud Simonem coriarium, cujus est domus juxta mare: hic tibi dicet quid te oporteat facere.
verses.english: He lodgeth with one Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea side. He will tell thee what thou must do.

verses.latin: Profecto autem angelus qui loquebatur ad Cornelium, cum abisset, vocavit duos domesticos suos, et militem religiosum de his qui illi assistebant,
verses.english: And when the angel who spoke to Cornelius was departed, he called two of his servants, and a soldier that was religious, of them that were with him,

verses.latin: quibus cum narrasset omnia, misit illos Joppen.
verses.english: To whom when he had related all, he sent them to Joppe.

verses.latin: Et altera die, iter illis facientibus, et civitati appropinquantibus, ascendit Petrus in superiora ut oraret circa horam sextam.
verses.english: And on the next day, whilst they were going on their journey, and drawing nigh to the city, Peter went up to the higher parts of the house to pray, about the sixth hour.

verses.latin: Et esuriens desiderabat cibum: parantibus autem illis, cecidit super eum mentis excessus:
verses.english: And being hungry, he was desirous to taste something. And whilst they were preparing, there came upon him an ecstasy of mind:

verses.latin: et vidit caelum apertum, et descendens vas quoddam, velut linteum magnum, quattuor initiis submitti de caelo in terram,
verses.english: And he saw the heaven opened, and a certain vessel descending, as it were a great sheet, let down from heaven by four corners to the earth,

verses.latin: in quo erant omnia animalia terrestria, et bestiae, et volucres caeli.
verses.english: Wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts, and creeping things of the earth, and fowls of the air.

verses.latin: Et vox facta est ad eum: Surge Petre, et macta, et manduca.
verses.english: And there came a voice to him: Arise, Peter; kill and eat.

verses.latin: Petrus autem dixit: Absit: Domine, quia numquam manducavi omne commune et immundum.
verses.english: But Peter said: Far be it from me; for I have never eaten any thing that is common and unclean.

verses.latin: Et vox iterum secundo ad eum: Quod Deus purificavit, ne tu commune dixeris.
verses.english: And the voice came again to him the second time: That which God hath made clean, do not thou call common.

verses.latin: Hoc autem factum est per ter, et statim receptum est vas in caelum.
verses.english: And this was done thrice: and incontinently the vessel was taken up into heaven.

verses.latin: Et dum intra se hæsitaret Petrus quidnam esset visio, quam vidisset, ecce viri qui missi erant a Cornelio, inquirentes domum Simonis, adstiterunt ante januam.
verses.english: And as Peter was doubting within himself, what the vision that he had seen might mean, behold, the men that were sent from Cornelius, inquiring for Simon's house, stood at the gate.

verses.latin: Et cum vocassent, interrogabant si Simon, qui cognominatur Petrus, illic hospitaretur.
verses.english: And when they had called, they asked if Simon, who is surnamed Peter, were lodged there.

verses.latin: Petro autem cogitante de visione, dixit Spiritus ei: Ecce viri tres quærunt te.
verses.english: And as Peter was thinking of the vision, the Spirit said to him: Behold, three men seek thee.

verses.latin: Surge itaque, et descende, et vade cum eis, nihil dubitans: quia ego misi illos.
verses.english: Arise, therefore, and go down, and do not hesitate to go with them: for I have sent them.

verses.latin: Descendens autem Petrus ad viros qui missi fuerant a Cornelio, dixit: Ego sum quem quæritis: quæ causa est propter quam venistis?
verses.english: Then Peter, going down to the men, said: Behold, I am he whom you seek. What is the cause for which you are come?

verses.latin: Qui dixerunt: Cornelius centurio, vir justus et timens Deum, et testimonium habens ab universa gente Judæorum, divinitus responso accepit ab angelo sancto accersire te in domum suam, et audire verba a te.
verses.english: Who said: Cornelius, the centurion, a just man, and one that feareth God, and that hath good testimony from all the nation of the Jews, received an answer from God by a holy angel, to send for thee into his house, and to hear words from thee.

verses.latin: Introducens igitur illos, hospitio suscepit. Sequenti autem die, surgens profectus est cum illis: et quidam ex fratribus qui erant a Joppe, comitati sunt eum.
verses.english: Then bringing them in, he lodged them. And the day following, he arose and went with them: and some of the brethren from Joppe accompanied him.

verses.latin: Et altera die introivit in Caesaream. Cornelius autem expectabat illos, convocatis propinquis suis et necessariis amicis.
verses.english: And the next day they entered into Cesarea. And Cornelius was waiting for them, having called together his kinsmen and special friends.

verses.latin: Et factum est cum introisset Petrus, obvius ei Cornelius, et procidens adoravit.
verses.english: And it came to pass that when Peter was come in, Cornelius came to meet him, and fell down and worshipped him.

verses.latin: Petrus autem elevatus eum, dixit: Surge, et ego ipse homo sum.
verses.english: But Peter lifted him up, saying: Arise, I myself also am a man.

verses.latin: Et loquens cum eo, intravit, et invenit multos qui convenerant:
verses.english: And as he was talking with him, he went in, and found many that were come together:

verses.latin: et dixit ad illos: Vos scitis quomodo illicitum sit viro Judæo conjungi, aut accedere ad alienigenam: sed mihi Deus ostendit neminem communem aut immundum dicere hominem.
verses.english: And he said to them: You know how unlawful it is for a man that is a Jew, to keep company or to come unto one of another nation: but God hath shewed to me, not to call any man common or unclean.

verses.latin: Ideo et sine dubitatione veni accersitus. Interrogo ergo, quam ob causam accersistis me?
verses.english: Therefore I came without any doubt, being sent for. I ask, therefore, for what cause have you sent for me?

verses.latin: Et Cornelius ait: A die quarto usque in hanc horam, orans eram hora nona in domo mea: et ecce vir stetit ante me in veste candida, et dixit:
verses.english: And Cornelius said: Four days ago, I was fasting until this hour, and I prayed in my house at the ninth hour, and behold a man stood before me in white clothing, and said:

verses.latin: Corneli, exaudita est oratio tua, et eleemosynæ tuæ in memoriam venerunt in conspectu Dei.
verses.english: Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, and thy alms are in remembrance in the sight of God.

verses.latin: Mitte ergo in Joppen, et accersi Simonem qui cognominatur Petrus: hic hospitatur in domo Simonis coriarii juxta mare. Cum venerit, loquetur tibi.
verses.english: Send therefore to Joppe, and call hither Simon, who is surnamed Peter: he lodgeth in the house of Simon a tanner, by the sea side. He will tell thee what thou must do.

verses.latin: Confestim itaque misi ad te: et tu benigne fecisti veniendo. Nunc ergo omnes nos in conspectu tuo adsumus, audire omnia quæ tibi a Deo præcepta sunt.
verses.english: Immediately therefore I sent to thee: and thou hast done well in coming. Now therefore are we all here present in thy sight, to hear all things whatsoever are commanded thee by God.

verses.latin: Aperiens autem Petrus os suum, dixit: In veritate comperi quia non est personarum acceptor Deus:
verses.english: And Peter opening his mouth, said: In very deed I perceive that God is not a respecter of persons:

verses.latin: sed in omni gente, qui timet eum, et operatur justitiam, acceptus est illi.
verses.english: But in every nation, he that feareth him, and worketh justice, is acceptable to him.

verses.latin: Verbum misit filiis Israël, annuntians pacem per Jesum Christum: hic est omnium Dominus.
verses.english: God sent the Son to the children of Israel, to announce peace through Jesus Christ: (he is the Lord of all things).

verses.latin: Vos scitis quod factum est verbum per universam Judæam: incipiens a Galilæa post baptismum quod prædicavit Joannes.
verses.english: You know what happened, the Word spoken throughout all Judea. It all started in Galilee, after the baptism that John proclaimed.

verses.latin: Jesum a Nazareth: quomodo unxit eum Deus Spiritu Sancto, et virtute, qui pertransiit benefaciendo, et sanando omnes oppressos a Diabolo, quoniam Deus cum illo erat.
verses.english: The mission of Jesus from Nazareth: How God anointed Him with the Holy Spirit and with power, and he passed by doing good and healing all that were oppressed by the devil, for God was with Him.

verses.latin: Et nos testes sumus omnium quæ fecit in regione Judæorum, et Jerosolymis: quem occiderunt suspendentes in ligno.
verses.english: And we are witnesses of all things that he did in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem: whom they killed, hanging him upon a tree.

verses.latin: Hunc Deus suscitavit tertia die, et dedit eum manifestum fieri,
verses.english: Him God raised up the third day, and gave him to be made manifest,

verses.latin: non omni populo, sed testibus præordinatis a Deo, nobis, qui manducavimus et bibimus cum illo postquam resurrexit a mortuis:
verses.english: Not to all the people, but to witnesses preordained by God, even to us, who did eat and drink with him after he rose again from the dead:

verses.latin: et præcepit nobis prædicare populo, et testificari quia ipse est qui constitutus est a Deo judex vivorum et mortuorum.
verses.english: And he commanded us to preach to the people, and to testify that it is he who was appointed by God to be judge of the living and of the dead.

verses.latin: Huic omnes prophetæ testimonium perhibent, remissionem peccatorum accipere per nomen ejus omnes qui credunt in eum.
verses.english: To him all the prophets give testimony, that through his name all receive remission of sins, who believe in him.

verses.latin: Adhuc loquente Petro hæc verba, cecidit Spiritus Sanctus super omnes qui audiebant verbum.
verses.english: While Peter was yet speaking these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them that heard the word.

verses.latin: Et obstipuerunt ex circumcisione fideles, qui venerant cum Petro, quia et in gentibus gratia Spiritus Sancti effusa est.
verses.english: And they of the circumcision, who believed, were astonished at them that were come with Peter, because that the grace of the Holy Ghost was also poured out upon the Gentiles.

verses.latin: Audiebant enim illos loquentes linguis, et magnificantes Deum. Tunc respondit Petrus:
verses.english: For they heard them speaking with tongues, and magnifying God. Then Peter answered:

verses.latin: Numquid aquam prohibere potest quis, ut non baptizentur hi qui Spiritum Sanctum acceperunt sicut et nos?
verses.english: Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, who have received the Holy Ghost as well as we?

verses.latin: Et jussit eos baptizari in nomine Domini Jesu Christi. Tunc rogaverunt eum manere dies aliquot.
verses.english: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ. Then they besought him to tarry with them some days.

verses.latin: Audierunt autem Apostoli, et fratres, qui erant per Judæam, quoniam et Gentes suscepissent verbum Dei.
verses.english: The apostles and the brothers and sisters throughout Judea then heard that the Gentiles had received the word of God.

verses.latin: Cum autem ascendisset Petrus Jerosolymam, disceptabant adversus eum, qui ex circumcisione erant,
verses.english: When Peter went up to Jerusalem, those of the circumcision began to argue with him,

verses.latin: dicentes: Quare introisti ad viros præputiatos, et manducasti cum illis?
verses.english: saying, "Why did you go in to uncircumcised men and eat with them?"

verses.latin: Petrus autem exorsus est eis exponere ordinem.
verses.english: Peter then began to explain the matter to them in order.

verses.latin: Dicit: Ego eram in civitate Joppe orans, et vidi in excessu mentis visionem, descendente vas, velut linteum magnum, quod quatuor initiis sustineretur de cælo, et venit usque ad me.
verses.english: He said, "I was in the city of Joppa, praying; and in a trance I saw a vision: a certain vessel descended, as it were a great sheet, let down from heaven by four corners, and it came even to me.

verses.latin: In quod intuens, considerabam, et vidi quadrupeda terræ, et bestias, et reptilia, et volatilia cæli.
verses.english: In this vision I looked and saw the four-footed beasts of the earth, and wild animals, and creeping things, and the birds of the sky.

verses.latin: Audivi autem et vocem dicentem mihi: Surge, Petre, occide, et manduca.
verses.english: And I heard a voice saying to me, 'Rise, Peter; kill and eat.'

verses.latin: Dixi autem: Absit, Domine: quia commune aut immundum numquam intravit in os meum.
verses.english: But I said, 'Not so, Lord; for nothing common or unclean has ever entered my mouth.'

verses.latin: Responsum autem secundo vox de cælo: Quæ Deus purificavit, ne tu commune dixeris.
verses.english: But the voice answered again from heaven, 'What God has cleansed, do not you call common.'

verses.latin: Hoc autem factum est per ter, et recepta sunt omnia rursum in cælum.
verses.english: Now this was done three times, and all were drawn up again into heaven.

verses.latin: Et ecce, confestim tres viri astiterunt in domo in qua eram, missi a Cæsarea ad me.
verses.english: And behold, immediately three men stood before the house in which I was, sent from Caesarea to me.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Spiritus mihi, ut irem cum illis, nihil dubitans. Venerunt autem mecum et hi sex fratres: et introivimus in domum viri.
verses.english: And the Spirit told me to go with them, making no distinction. And these six brothers went with me also, and we entered into the man's house.

verses.latin: Narravitque nobis, quomodo vidit angelum in domo sua, stantem, et dicentem sibi: Mitte in Joppen, et accersi Simonem, qui cognominatur Petrus,
verses.english: And he told us how he had seen an angel in his house, standing and saying to him, 'Send to Joppa and get Simon, who is called Peter,'

verses.latin: qui loquetur tibi verba, in quibus salvus eris tu, et omnis domus tua.
verses.english: who will speak words to you by which you will be saved, you and all your household.'

verses.latin: Cum autem cœpissem loqui, cecidit Spiritus Sanctus super eos, sicut et in principio super nos.
verses.english: And as I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them, just as on us in the beginning.

verses.latin: Recordatus sum autem verbi Domini, quemadmodum dicebat: Joannes quidem baptizavit aqua, vos autem baptizabimini Spiritu Sancto.
verses.english: Then I remembered the word of the Lord, how He said, 'John indeed baptized with water, but you shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit.'

verses.latin: Si ergo eandem gratiam dedit Deus illis, sicut et nobis, qui credidimus in Dominum Jesum Christum: ego quis eram, qui possem prohibere Deum?
verses.english: If then God gave the same gift to them as to us when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I that I could withstand God?

verses.latin: His auditis, tacuerunt: et glorificaverunt Deum, dicentes: Ergo et Gentibus pœnitentiam dedit Deus ad vitam.
verses.english: When they heard these things, they held their peace and glorified God, saying, "Then God has also granted to the Gentiles repentance to life."

verses.latin: Illi igitur, qui dispersi fuerant a tribulatione, quæ facta est circa Stephanum, ambulabant usque Phœnicen, et Cyprum, et Antiochiam, nihil loquentes nisi Judæis solis verbum Dei.
verses.english: Now they who were scattered by the persecution that arose over Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia, and Cyprus, and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except the Jews only.

verses.latin: Erant autem quidam ex eis viri Cyprii, et Cyrenæi, qui, cum introissent Antiochiam, loquebantur et ad Græcos, annuntiantes Dominum Jesum.
verses.english: But there were some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they had come to Antioch, spoke also to the Greeks, preaching the Lord Jesus.

verses.latin: Et erat manus Domini cum illis: numerusque credentium conversus est ad Dominum multus.
verses.english: And the hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number believed and turned to the Lord.

verses.latin: Pervenerat autem sermo ad aures ecclesiæ, quæ erat Jerosolymis, super istis: miserunt Barnabam usque Antiochiam.
verses.english: Then tidings of these things came to the ears of the church in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas to Antioch.

verses.latin: Qui cum pervenisset, et vidisset gratiam Dei, gavisus est: et hortabatur omnes in proposito cordis permanere in Domino.
verses.english: When he had come and seen the grace of God, he was glad, and he exhorted them all that with purpose of heart they should continue with the Lord.

verses.latin: Quia erat vir bonus, et plenus Spiritu Sancto, et fide. Et addita est multa turba Domino.
verses.english: For he was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and of faith. And a great number of people were added to the Lord.

verses.latin: Profectus est autem Barnabas Tarsum, ut quæreret Saulum:
verses.english: Then Barnabas went to Tarsus to seek Saul.

verses.latin: et cum invenisset eum, adduxit Antiochiam. Factum est autem illis, ut per unum annum in ecclesia conversarentur, et docerent turbam multam, ita ut primum Antiochiæ discipuli cognominarentur Christiani.
verses.english: And when he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. So it was that for a whole year they assembled with the church and taught a great number of people. And the disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.

verses.latin: In his autem diebus, venerunt ab Jerosolymis prophetæ Antiochiam:
verses.english: And in these days prophets came from Jerusalem to Antioch.

verses.latin: unus ex illis nomine Agabus: et significavit per spiritum, famem magnam futuram in universo orbe terrarum: quæ facta est sub Claudio.
verses.english: Then one of them, named Agabus, stood up and showed by the Spirit that there would be a great famine throughout all the world, which also happened in the days of Claudius Caesar.

verses.latin: Discipuli autem, prout facultas erat uniuscujusque, proposuerunt singuli in ministerium mittere in subsidium fratribus, qui habitabant in Judæa:
verses.english: Then the disciples, each according to his ability, determined to send relief to the brethren dwelling in Judea.

verses.latin: quod et fecerunt, mittentes ad presbyteros per manus Barnabæ et Sauli.
verses.english: This they also did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.

verses.latin: Eodem autem tempore misit Herodes rex manus, ut adfligeret quosdam de Ecclesia.
verses.english: At that same time, Herod the king had some members of the Church arrested.

verses.latin: Interfecit autem Iacobum fratrem Ioannis gladio.
verses.english: He killed James, the brother of John, with a sword.

verses.latin: Videns autem quia placuit Iudaeis, apposuit ut et Petrum comprehenderet. Erant autem dies Azymorum.
verses.english: When he saw that this pleased the Jews, he had Peter arrested as well. This happened during the days of Unleavened Bread.

verses.latin: Quem cum apprehendisset, misit in carcerem, tradens quattuor quaternionibus militum custodiendum, volens post Pascha illum producere populo.
verses.english: Having arrested him, he put him in prison, entrusting him to four squads of soldiers to guard him, intending to bring him before the people after the Passover.

verses.latin: Petrus quidem servabatur in carcere. Oratio autem fiebat sine intermissione ab Ecclesia ad Deum pro eo.
verses.english: So Peter was kept in prison, but the Church was praying to God for him, constantly.

verses.latin: Cum autem illum Herodes producturus esset, in ipsa nocte erat Petrus dormiens inter duos milites, vinctus duabus cathenis: et custodes ante ostium custodiebant carcerem.
verses.english: The night before Herod was going to bring him out, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, and guards were in front of the door, guarding the prison.

verses.latin: Et ecce angelus Domini astitit, et lux refulsit in habitaculo: percussitque Petrum in latus, et suscitavit eum, dicens: Surge velociter. Et ceciderunt catenae de manibus ejus.
verses.english: Suddenly, an angel of the Lord appeared, and light shone in the cell. He struck Peter on the side and woke him up, saying, "Get up quickly!" And the chains fell from his hands.

verses.latin: Dixit autem angelus ad eum: Praecingere te, et calcea te sandalia. Et fecit ita. Et dixit illi: Circumda tibi vestimentum tuum, et sequere me.
verses.english: The angel said to him, "Put on your belt and put on your sandals." And he did so. The angel said to him, "Wrap your cloak around you and follow me."

verses.latin: Et exiens sequebatur eum. Et nesciebat quia verum est quod fiebat per angelum: existimabat autem se visum videre.
verses.english: Peter went out and followed him, though he didn't know that what the angel was doing was real; he thought he was seeing a vision.

verses.latin: Transeuntes autem primam et secundam custodiam, venerunt ad portam ferream, quae ducit ad civitatem: quae ultro aperta est eis. Et exeuntes processerunt vicum unum: et continuo discessit angelus ab eo.
verses.english: They passed the first and second guards and came to the iron gate leading to the city. It opened for them on its own. They went out and walked along one street, and then the angel left him.

verses.latin: Petrus autem ad se reversus, dixit: Nunc scio vere, quia misit Dominus angelum suum, et eripuit me de manu Herodis, et de omni exspectatione plebis Judaeorum.
verses.english: Then Peter came to himself and said, "Now I know for certain that the Lord has sent His angel and rescued me from Herod and from everything the Jewish people were hoping for."

verses.latin: Considerans autem venit ad domum Mariæ matris Joannis, qui cognominabatur Marcus, ubi erant multi congregati, et orantes.
verses.english: When he realized this, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John, also called Mark, where many people were gathered and praying.

verses.latin: Pulsante autem eo ostium januæ, processit puella ad audiendum, quæ vocabatur Rhode.
verses.english: Peter knocked at the door, and a servant girl named Rhoda came to answer it.

verses.latin: Et cum cognovisset vocem Petri, præ gaudio non aperuit januam, sed intro currens nuntiavit stare Petrum ante januam.
verses.english: Recognizing Peter's voice, she was so overjoyed that she didn't open the door, but ran in and announced that Peter was standing at the door.

verses.latin: At illi dixerunt ad eam: Sapis. Illa autem adfirmabat sic se habere. Illi autem dicebant: Angelus ejus est.
verses.english: They said to her, "You're out of your mind." But she insisted that it was true. They said, "It must be his angel."

verses.latin: Petrus autem perseverabat pulsans. Cum autem aperuissent, viderunt eum, et obstupuerunt.
verses.english: But Peter kept knocking. When they opened the door and saw him, they were astonished.

verses.latin: Annuit autem illis manu, ut tacerent: et narravit illis quomodo Dominus eduxisset eum de carcere. Et dixit: Nuntiate Jacobo et fratribus hæc. Et egressus abiit in alium locum.
verses.english: He motioned to them with his hand to be quiet and then told them how the Lord had brought him out of prison. "Tell James and the other brothers about this," he said, and then he left and went to another place.

verses.latin: Facta autem die, erat non parvus turbatio inter milites, quidnam factus esset Petrus.
verses.english: In the morning, there was a great commotion among the soldiers about what had happened to Peter.

verses.latin: Herodes autem, cum requisisset eum, et non invenisset, inquisitione facta de custodibus, jussit eos duci: et descendens de Judæa in Cæsaream, morabatur.
verses.english: After Herod had a thorough search for him and did not find him, he interrogated the guards and ordered that they be executed. Then Herod went down from Judea to Caesarea and stayed there.

verses.latin: Erat autem Herodes iratus Tyriis et Sidoniis. At illi unanimes venerunt ad eum, et persuaso facto Blasto, qui erat a cubiculo regis, postulabant pacem, eo quod alerentur regiones eorum ab eo.
verses.english: Herod was furious with the people of Tyre and Sidon, but they came to him in a body. After getting Blastus, the king's personal aide, on their side, they asked for peace, because their country depended on Herod's country for its food supply.

verses.latin: Die autem constituto, Herodes indutus veste regia, sedens pro tribunali, concionabatur ad eos.
verses.english: On the appointed day, Herod, wearing royal robes, sat on his throne and delivered a speech to them.

verses.latin: Populus autem clamabat: Dei vox, et non hominis.
verses.english: The crowd began to shout, "This is the voice of a god, not of a man."

verses.latin: Confestim autem percussus est ab angelo Domini, eo quod non dedisset honorem Deo: et consumptus a vermibus, exspiravit.
verses.english: Immediately, because Herod did not give praise to God, the angel of the Lord struck him down, and he was eaten by worms and died.

verses.latin: Verbum autem Domini crescebat et multiplicabatur.
verses.english: But the Word of the Lord continued to spread and flourish.

verses.latin: Barnabas autem et Saulus reversi sunt ab Jerosolymis, expleto ministerio, assumpto secum Joanne, qui cognominabatur Marcus.
verses.english: Then Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem after completing their mission, taking John, also called Mark, with them.

verses.latin: Erat autem in Antiochia in Ecclesia, quae ibi erat, prophetae et doctores, Barnabas, et Simon, qui vocabatur Niger, et Lucius Cyrenensis, et Manahen, qui erat Herodis tetrarchae conlactaneus, et Saulus.
verses.english: Now in the Church that was in Antioch there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas, and Simon who was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen, who was brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

verses.latin: Ministrantibus autem illis Domino, et jejunantibus, dixit illis Spiritus Sanctus: Segregate mihi Barnaban et Saulum in opus, ad quod assumpsi eos.
verses.english: As they were ministering to the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said: “Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”

verses.latin: Tunc jejunantes et orantes, et imponentes eis manus, dimiserunt illos.
verses.english: Then, after they had fasted and prayed and laid hands on them, they sent them away.

verses.latin: Ipsi igitur missi a Spiritu Sancto, abierunt Seleuciam: et inde navigaverunt in Cyprum.
verses.english: So they, being sent on a mission by the Holy Spirit, went down to Seleucia; and from there they sailed to Cyprus.

verses.latin: Et cum venissent Salaminam, praedicabant verbum Dei in synagogis Judaeorum. Habebant autem et Joannem in ministerio.
verses.english: And when they came to Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews. And they had John in their ministry.

verses.latin: Et cum perambulassent universam insulam usque Paphum, invenerunt virum quemdam magum pseudoprophetam, Judaeum, cui nomen erat Barjesu,
verses.english: And when they had gone through the whole island as far as Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew whose name was Bar-Jesus,

verses.latin: qui erat cum proconsule Sergio Paulo, viro prudente. Hic, accitis Barnaba et Saulo, desiderabat audire verbum Dei.
verses.english: who was with the proconsul Sergius Paulus, a man of intelligence. This man called for Barnabas and Saul and was eager to hear the word of God.

verses.latin: Resistebat autem illis Elymas magus (sic enim interpretatur nomen ejus): quaerens avertere proconsulem a fide.
verses.english: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is the meaning of his name) was resisting them, seeking to turn the proconsul away from the faith.

verses.latin: Saulus autem, qui et Paulus, repletus Spiritu Sancto, intuens in eum,
verses.english: But Saul, who is also called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, looking intently at him,

verses.latin: dixit: O plene omni dolo et omni fallacia, fili diaboli, inimice omnis justitiae, non desines subvertere vias Domini rectas?
verses.english: said: “O full of all deceit and all fraud, you son of the devil, enemy of all righteousness, will you not cease to pervert the straight ways of the Lord?

verses.latin: Et nunc ecce manus Domini super te: et eris caecus, non videns solem usque ad tempus. Et confestim cecidit in eum caligo, et tenebrae, et circuiens quaerebat, qui ei manum daret.
verses.english: And now, behold, the hand of the Lord is upon you, and you will be blind, not seeing the sun for a time.” And immediately a mist and darkness fell upon him, and he went about seeking someone to lead him by the hand.

verses.latin: Tunc proconsul, cum vidisset factum, credidit, admirans super doctrina Domini.
verses.english: Then the proconsul, when he saw what had happened, believed, being astonished at the teaching of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et cum Paulus, et qui cum eo erant, navigassent a Papho, venerunt Pamphyliam, in Phergen. Et Joannes discedens ab eis, reversus est Jerosolymam.
verses.english: Now when Paul and his companions set sail from Paphos, they came to Pamphylia, to Perga. And John, departing from them, returned to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Illi vero pertranseuntes a Phergen, venerunt Antiochiam Pisidiae: et ingressi synagogam die sabbati, sederunt.
verses.english: But they, passing on from Perga, came to Antioch in Pisidia; and on the Sabbath they went into the synagogue and sat down.

verses.latin: Post lectionem autem legis, et prophetarum, miserunt principes synagogae ad eos, dicentes: Viri fratres, si quis est in vobis sermo exhortationis ad plebem, dicite.
verses.english: After the reading of the Law and the Prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent to them, saying, “Men, brothers, if there is any word of exhortation for the people, speak.”

verses.latin: Surgens autem Paulus, et manu silentium faciens, ait: Viri Israëlitæ, et qui timetis Deum, audite.
verses.english: Then Paul stood up and, motioning with his hand, said: “Men of Israel, and you who fear God, listen.

verses.latin: Deus plebis Israel elegit patres nostros, et plebem exaltavit, cum essent incolae in terra Aegypti, et in brachio excelso eduxit eos ex ea,
verses.english: The God of the people of Israel chose our fathers and exalted the people when they were sojourners in the land of Egypt, and with a high arm he led them out of it,

verses.latin: et per quadraginta annorum spatium sustinuit eos in deserto.
verses.english: and for about forty years he put up with them in the wilderness.

verses.latin: Et destruens gentes septem in terra Chanaan, sorte distribuit eis terram eorum,
verses.english: And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, he distributed their land to them by lot,

verses.latin: quasi post quadringentos et quinquaginta annos: et post haec dedit judices, usque ad Samuel prophetam.
verses.english: as it were, for about four hundred and fifty years. And after that he gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.

verses.latin: Et inde petierunt regem: et dedit illis Deus Saul filium Cis, virum de tribu Benjamin, annis quadraginta.
verses.english: And then they asked for a king, and God gave them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.

verses.latin: Et amoto illo, suscitavit illis David in regem: cui testimonium perhibens dixit: Inveni David filium Jesse, virum secundum cor meum, qui faciet omnes voluntates meas.
verses.english: And when he had removed him, he raised up David to be their king, of whom he bore witness and said, ‘I have found in David the son of Jesse, a man after my heart, who will do all my will.’

verses.latin: Hujus Deus ex semine secundum promissionem eduxit Israël salvatorem Jesum,
verses.english: From the offspring of this man, according to the promise, God brought to Israel a Savior, Jesus,

verses.latin: praedicante Joanne ante adventum ejus baptismum poenitentiae omni populo Israel.
verses.english: before whose coming John had preached a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Cum impleret autem Joannes cursum suum, dicebat: Quem me arbitramini esse, ego non sum: sed ecce venit post me, cujus non sum dignus calceamenta pedum solvere.
verses.english: And as John was finishing his course, he said, ‘What do you suppose that I am? I am not the one. But behold, one comes after me, whose sandal I am not worthy to untie.’

verses.latin: Viri fratres, filii generis Abraham, et qui in vobis timent Deum, vobis verbum salutis istius missum est.
verses.english: “Men, brothers, children of the family of Abraham, and those among you who fear God, to you the word of this salvation has been sent.

verses.latin: Nam qui habitant in Jerusalem, et principes ejus, hunc ignorantes, et voces prophetarum qui per omne sabbatum leguntur, judicantes, impleverunt.
verses.english: For those who live in Jerusalem and their rulers, because they did not recognize him, nor understand the voices of the prophets which are read every Sabbath, fulfilled these prophecies by condemning him.

verses.latin: Et nullam causam mortis invenientes, petierunt a Pilato ut interficerent eum.
verses.english: And though they found in him no cause for death, they asked Pilate to have him executed.

verses.latin: Cumque consummassent omnia quae de eo scripta erant, deponentes eum de ligno, posuerunt in monumento.
verses.english: And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him, they took him down from the tree and laid him in a tomb.

verses.latin: Deus vero suscitavit eum a mortuis tertia die:
verses.english: But God raised him from the dead on the third day.

verses.latin: qui visus est per dies multos eis, qui simul ascenderant cum eo de Galilaea in Jerosolymam: qui usque nunc sunt testes ejus ad plebem.
verses.english: And for many days he appeared to those who had come up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are now his witnesses to the people.

verses.latin: Et nos vobis annuntiamus eam, quae ad patres promissio facta est, quod hanc Deus adimplevit filiis eorum resuscitans Jesum,
verses.english: And we bring you good news of the promise that was made to the fathers, that God has fulfilled this promise to their children by raising up Jesus,

verses.latin: sicut et in psalmo secundo scriptum est: Filius meus es tu, ego hodie genui te.
verses.english: as it is also written in the second Psalm, ‘You are my Son; today I have become your Father.’

verses.latin: Quod autem suscitavit eum a mortuis, amplius jam non reversurum in corruptionem, ita dixit: Dabo vobis sancta David fidelia.
verses.english: And that he raised him from the dead, no more to return to corruption, he has spoken in this way: ‘I will give you the holy and sure blessings of David.’

verses.latin: Ideoque et alio in loco dicit: Non dabis sanctum tuum videre corruptionem.
verses.english: Therefore he says also in another place, ‘You will not let your Holy One see corruption.’

verses.latin: David enim in sua generatione, cum expletis voluntatibus suis inposito, dormivit in voluntate, et appositus est ad patres suos, et vidit corruptionem.
verses.english: For David, after he had served the purpose of God in his own generation, fell asleep and was laid with his fathers and saw corruption,

verses.latin: quem vero Deus suscitavit a mortuis, non vidit corruptionem.
verses.english: but he whom God raised up did not see corruption.

verses.latin: Notum igitur sit vobis viri fratres, quod per hunc vobis remissio peccatorum annuntiatur: et ab omnibus, quibus non potuistis in lege Moysi justificari,
verses.english: Let it be known to you therefore, men, brothers, that through this man forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you, and by him everyone who believes is freed from everything from which you could not be freed by the law of Moses.

verses.latin: ab hoc omnis qui credit, justificatur.
verses.english: and by him everyone who believes is freed from everything from which you could not be freed by the law of Moses.

verses.latin: Videte ergo, ne veniat super vos quod dictum est in prophetis:
verses.english: Beware, therefore, lest what is said in the prophets should come about:

verses.latin: Videte contemptores, et admiramini, et disperdimini: quia opus facio in diebus vestris, opus quod non credetis, si narraverit vobis aliquis.
verses.english: “Look, you scoffers, and wonder and perish; for I am doing a work in your days, a work that you will not believe, even if one tells it to you.”

verses.latin: Exeuntibus autem illis, rogabant ut sequenti sabbato loquerentur sibi de verbis istis.
verses.english: As they went out, they begged that these words might be spoken to them the next Sabbath.

verses.latin: Cumque dimissa esset synagoga, secuti sunt multi Judaeorum, et colentium proselutorum Paulum et Barnabam: qui loquentes suadebant eis perseverare in gratia Dei.
verses.english: And after the meeting of the synagogue broke up, many of the Jews and devout converts to Judaism followed Paul and Barnabas, who, as they spoke with them, urged them to continue in the grace of God.

verses.latin: Sequenti autem sabbato pene universa civitas convenit audire verbum Dei.
verses.english: The next Sabbath almost the whole city gathered to hear the word of God.

verses.latin: Videntes autem Judaei turbas, repleti sunt zelo, et contradicebant his quae a Paulo dicebantur, repugnantes et blasphemantes.
verses.english: But when the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy and began to contradict what was spoken by Paul, reviling him.

verses.latin: Tunc constanter Paulus et Barnabas dixerunt: Vobis oportebat primum loqui verbum Dei: sed quoniam repellitis illud, et indignos vos judicatis aeternae vitae, ecce convertimur ad gentes.
verses.english: And Paul and Barnabas spoke out boldly, saying, “It was necessary that the word of God be spoken first to you. But since you reject it and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, behold, we are turning to the Gentiles.

verses.latin: Sic enim praecepit nobis Dominus: Posui te in lucem gentium, ut sis in salutem usque ad extremum terrae.
verses.english: For so the Lord has commanded us, saying, ‘I have made you a light for the Gentiles, that you may bring salvation to the ends of the earth.’

verses.latin: Gentes autem audientes, gaudebant, et glorificabant verbum Domini: et crediderunt quotquot erant praeordinati ad vitam aeternam.
verses.english: And when the Gentiles heard this, they began rejoicing and glorifying the word of the Lord, and as many as were appointed to eternal life believed.

verses.latin: Verbum autem Domini divulgabatur per universam regionem.
verses.english: And the word of the Lord was spreading throughout the whole region.

verses.latin: Judaei autem concitaverunt mulieres religiosas et honorabiles, et optimates civitatis: et moverunt persecutionem in Paulum et Barnabam: et ejecerunt eos a finibus suis.
verses.english: But the Jews incited the devout women of high standing and the leading men of the city, and stirred up persecution against Paul and Barnabas and drove them out of their district.

verses.latin: Illi vero excusso pulvere pedum in eos, venerunt Iconium.
verses.english: But they shook off the dust from their feet against them and went to Iconium.

verses.latin: Discipuli quoque replebantur gaudio, et Spiritu Sancto.
verses.english: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: Factum est autem Iconii, ut una introirent synagogam Judaeorum, et loquerentur, ita credidit Judaeorum et Graecorummultitudo magna.
verses.english: In Iconium, Paul and Barnabas continued to enter into the synagogue. They preached, and a large multitude of both Jews and Greeks believed.

verses.latin: Increduli vero Judaei suscitaverunt et ad iracundiam concitaverunt animas gentium adversus fratres.
verses.english: But the Jews who refused to believe stirred up the Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brothers.

verses.latin: Multo igitur tempore demorati sunt, fiducialiter agentes in Domino, testimonium perhibente verbo gratiae suae, dante signa et prodigia fieri per manus eorum.
verses.english: Paul and Barnabas remained there a long time, speaking boldly, trusting in the Lord. God’s grace caused them to speak in power and perform miracles.

verses.latin: Divisa est autem multitudo civitatis: et quidam quidem erant cum Judaeis, quidam vero cum Apostolis.
verses.english: The city was divided. Some sided with the Jews, but others sided with the Apostles.

verses.latin: Factum est autem cum impetus fieret gentium, et Judaeorum cum principibus suis, ut injuriis afficerent, et lapidarent eos,
verses.english: When both the Gentiles and the Jews, along with their rulers, violently attacked the Apostles, intending to abuse them and stone them...

verses.latin: intelligentes confugerunt in Lystram et Derben, civitates Lycaoniae, et totam regionem in circuitu.
verses.english: ...they fled to the cities of Lystra and Derbe in Lycaonia and all the surrounding region.

verses.latin: Et ibi evangelizantes erant.
verses.english: They continued to preach there the Gospel.

verses.latin: Et quidam vir in Lystris infirmus pedibus sedebat, claudus ex utero matris suae, qui numquam ambulaverat.
verses.english: In Lystra, there was a man sitting who was crippled in his feet. He had been lame from birth, and had never walked.

verses.latin: Hic audivit Paulum loquentem: qui intuitus eum, et videns quod fidem haberet ut salvus fieret,
verses.english: He listened to Paul speaking. Paul looked at him, and seeing that he had the faith to be healed,

verses.latin: dixit magna voce: Surge super pedes tuos rectus. Et exiliit, et ambulabat.
verses.english: said in a loud voice, "Stand upright on your feet!" And he leaped up and began to walk.

verses.latin: Turbae autem cum vidissent quod fecerat Paulus, levaverunt vocem suam, dicentes lingua Lycaonia: Dii, facti similes hominibus, descenderunt ad nos.
verses.english: When the crowds saw what Paul had done, they shouted in the Lycaonian language, saying, “The gods have come down to us, in the likeness of men!”

verses.latin: Et vocabant Barnabam, Jovem: Paulum vero, Mercurium: quoniam ipse erat dux verbi.
verses.english: They called Barnabas “Jupiter,” and Paul “Mercury,” because Paul was the chief speaker.

verses.latin: Sacerdos quoque Jovis, qui erat ante civitatem, tauros et coronas ante januas afferens, cum turbis volebat sacrificare.
verses.english: The priest of Jupiter, whose temple was in front of the city, brought bulls and garlands to the gates, and with the crowds, wanted to offer sacrifice.

verses.latin: Quod ubi audierunt Apostoli, Barnabas et Paulus, conscissis tunicis suis, exiluerunt in turbas clamantes,
verses.english: But when the Apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heard this, they tore their clothes and rushed into the crowd, shouting:

verses.latin: et dicentes: Viri, quid haec facitis? Et nos mortales sumus, similes vobis: annuntiantes vobis, ut a vanis convertamini ad Deum vivum, qui fecit caelum et terram, et mare, et omnia quae in eis sunt:
verses.english: “Men, why are you doing this? We are also mortals, like you. We are preaching so that you turn from these empty things and come to the living God, who created the universe and the earth and the sea and all that is in them.

verses.latin: qui in praeteritis generationibus dimisit omnes gentes ambulare in viis suis.
verses.english: In generations past, he allowed all the Gentiles to follow their own ways.

verses.latin: Tametsi non sine testimonio reliquit seipsum, benefaciens de caelo, dans pluvias et tempora fructifera, implens corda vestra cibo et laetitia.
verses.english: Yet he did not leave himself without a witness. He did good, giving you rain from the sky and fruitful seasons, filling your hearts with food and joy.

verses.latin: Et haec dicentes, vix sedaverunt turbas, ne sibi sacrificarent.
verses.english: Even saying these things, it was barely enough to restrain the crowds from sacrificing to them.

verses.latin: Supervenerunt autem ab Antiochia et Iconio Judaei, et suadentes turbas, lapidantesque Paulum, traxerunt eum extra civitatem, existimantes mortuum.
verses.english: Then some Jews arrived from Antioch and Iconium, and they persuaded the crowds. They stoned Paul and dragged him outside the city, thinking he was dead.

verses.latin: Circumdantibus autem eum discipulis, surgens introivit civitatem, et postera die profectus est cum Barnaba in Derben.
verses.english: But when the disciples gathered around him, he rose up and went back into the city. The next day, he went with Barnabas to Derbe.

verses.latin: Cumque evangelisassent civitati illi, et docuissent multos, reversi sunt Lystram, et Iconium, et Antiochiam,
verses.english: After preaching the Gospel to that city and making many disciples, they returned to Lystra, Iconium, and Antioch,

verses.latin: confirmantes animas discipulorum, exhortantes ut permanerent in fide: et quoniam per multas tribulationes oportet nos introire in regnum Dei.
verses.english: strengthening the souls of the disciples, encouraging them to remain in the faith, because we must endure many tribulations to enter into the Kingdom of God.

verses.latin: Et cum constituissent illis per singulas ecclesias presbyteros, orantes cum jejunationibus, commendaverunt eos Domino, in quem crediderunt.
verses.english: Then they appointed presbyters for them in each church, with prayer and fasting, and commended them to the Lord in whom they had believed.

verses.latin: Transientes autem Pisidiam, venerunt in Pamphyliam,
verses.english: Then, after passing through Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.

verses.latin: et loquentes verbum Domini in Perge, descenderunt in Attaliam:
verses.english: After they spoke the word of the Lord in Perga, they went down to Attalia,

verses.latin: et inde navigaverunt Antiochiam, unde traditi fuerant gratiae Dei in opus, quod compleverunt.
verses.english: and from there they sailed to Antioch, where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work they had completed.

verses.latin: Cum autem venissent, et congregassent ecclesiam, narraverunt quanta fecisset Deus cum illis: et quia aperuisset gentibus ostium fidei.
verses.english: When they arrived, and gathered the Church, they reported all the things God had done with them, and that He had opened the door of faith to the Gentiles.

verses.latin: Morati sunt autem ibi cum discipulis non modico tempore.
verses.english: They stayed there with the disciples for a long time.

verses.latin: Descenderunt autem quidam de Judaea, et docebant fratres: Quia, nisi secundum morem Moysi circumcidamini, non potestis salvari.
verses.english: Certain men came down from Judea, and taught the brothers: “Unless you are circumcised according to the custom of Moses, you cannot be saved.”

verses.latin: Facta ergo seditione non minima Paulo et Barnabae adversus illos, statuerunt ut ascenderent Paulus et Barnabas, et quidam alii ex illis, ad apostolos et presbyteros in Jerúsalem super hac quæstione.
verses.english: When there was no small dissension and debate by Paul and Barnabas against them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas, and certain others of them, should go up to the apostles and priests in Jerusalem, about this question.

verses.latin: Ipsi igitur deducti ab ecclesia, pertransiebant Phœnicen et Samariam, narrantes conversionem gentium: et faciebant gaudium magnum omnibus fratribus.
verses.english: They therefore, having been led forward by the Church, were passing through Phoenicia and Samaria, narrating the conversion of the Gentiles: and they were making great joy to all the brothers.

verses.latin: Cum autem venissent Jerúsalem, suscepti sunt ab ecclesia et apostolis ac presbyteris, annuntiantes quanta Deus fecisset cum illis.
verses.english: When they came to Jerusalem, they were received by the Church and the apostles and priests, announcing how great a thing God had done with them.

verses.latin: Surrexerunt autem quidam de hæresi pharisæorum, qui crediderant, dicentes: Quia oportet circumcidere eos, præcipereque servare legem Moysi.
verses.english: Certain ones of the sect of the Pharisees, who had believed, rose up, saying: “It is necessary to circumcise them and command them to keep the law of Moses.”

verses.latin: Conveneruntque apostoli et seniores videre de verbo hoc.
verses.english: The apostles and the elders assembled to consider the word about this.

verses.latin: Multa autem cum disputatio facta esset, surgens Petrus, dixit ad eos: Viri fratres, vos scitis quoniam a diebus antiquis Deus in nobis elegit per os meum audire gentes verbum Evangelii, et credere.
verses.english: When there was much debate, Peter rose up and said to them: “Men, brothers, you know that from the ancient days God chose among us, that the Gentiles should hear the word of the Gospel by my mouth, and believe.”

verses.latin: Et Deus, qui novit corda, testimonium perhibuit, dans illis Spiritum Sanctum, sicut et nobis:
verses.english: And God, who knows the hearts, bore witness, giving to them the Holy Spirit, just as to us:

verses.latin: et nihil discríminis fecit inter nos et illos, purificans corda eorum fide.
verses.english: And He made no distinction between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo quid tentatis Deum, imponere jugum super cervices discipulorum, quod neque patres nostri, neque nos portare potuimus?
verses.english: Now therefore why are you tempting God, to put a yoke upon the necks of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we could bear?

verses.latin: Sed per gratiam Domini Jesu Christi credimus salvari, quemadmodum et illi.
verses.english: But through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, we believe that we shall be saved, in the same way as they also [shall be saved].

verses.latin: Silenuit autem omnis multitudo: et audiebant Barnabam et Paulum narrantes quanta fecisset Deus signa et prodigia in gentibus per eos.
verses.english: Then all the multitude fell silent: and they listened to Barnabas and Paul, relating how great signs and wonders God had done among the Gentiles by them.

verses.latin: Et postquam tacuerunt, respondit Jacobus, dicens: Viri fratres, audite me.
verses.english: And after they were silent, James answered, saying: “Men, brothers, hear me.

verses.latin: Symon narravit quemadmodum primum Deus visitavit, sumere ex gentibus populum sanctum nomini suo.
verses.english: Simon has recounted how God first visited, taking from the Gentiles a holy people for His name.

verses.latin: Et huic concordant verba prophetarum, sicut scriptum est:
verses.english: And with this agree the words of the prophets, as it is written:

verses.latin: Post hæc revertar, et ædificabo tabernaculum David, quod cecidit: et diruta ejus reædificabo, et erigam illud:
verses.english: “After these things I will return, and I will rebuild the tabernacle of David that has fallen: and I will rebuild its ruins, and I will raise it up:

verses.latin: ut reliqui hominum exquisitantes Dominum, et omnes gentes super quas invocatum est nomen meum, dicat Dominus faciens hæc.
verses.english: so that the rest of men may seek the Lord, and all the Gentiles, upon whom My name is called, says the Lord, who does these things.”

verses.latin: Notum a sæculo est Deo opus suum.
verses.english: Known from the beginning is His work with God.

verses.latin: Propter quod ego judico non inquietandos qui ex gentibus convertuntur ad Deum,
verses.english: Wherefore I judge that those who are converted to God from the Gentiles should not be disturbed,

verses.latin: sed scribere ad eos ut abstineant se a contaminationibus simulacrorum, et fornicatione, et suffocato, et sanguine.
verses.english: but that they should write to them that they abstain from the contaminations of idols, and from fornication, and from what is strangled, and from blood.

verses.latin: Moyses enim a sæculis habet per singulas civitates, qui eum prædicent in synagogis, ubi per singula sabbata legitur.
verses.english: For Moses, from the generations of old, has in every city those who preach him in the synagogues, where he is read every Sabbath.

verses.latin: Tunc placuit apostolis et senioribus cum omni ecclesia, eligere viros ex se, et mittere Antiochiam cum Paulo et Barnaba, Judam, qui cognominabatur Barsabas, et Silam, viros præcipuos in fratribus.
verses.english: Then it pleased the apostles and the elders, with the whole Church, to choose men from among themselves, and to send to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas, Judas, who was called Barsabas, and Silas, leading men among the brothers.

verses.latin: scribentes per manus eorum: Apostoli et seniores fratres, his qui sunt in Antiochiam, et Syriam, et Ciliciam, fratribus ex gentibus, salutem.
verses.english: Writing by their hands: “The apostles and the elder brothers to those in Antioch, and Syria, and Cilicia, brothers from the Gentiles, greeting.”

verses.latin: Quoniam quoniam audivimus quia quidam, ex nobis exierunt, turbantes vos verbis, subvertentes animas vestras, quibus non mandavimus:
verses.english: “Because we have heard that certain ones, who went out from among us, have disturbed you with words, subverting your souls, to whom we did not give any command:

verses.latin: placuit nobis collectis in unum, eligere viros et mittere ad vos cum dilectis nostris Barnaba et Paulo,
verses.english: it has pleased us, gathered together in one place, to choose men and send them to you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,

verses.latin: hominibus qui tradiderunt animas suas pro nomine Domini nostri Jesu Christi.
verses.english: men who have delivered their souls for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: Misimus ergo Judam et Silam, qui et ipsi vobis eaedem renunciabunt.
verses.english: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who also will tell you the same things.”

verses.latin: Visum est enim Spiritui Sancto, et nobis, nihil ultra onus vobis imponere, quam hæc necessaria:
verses.english: “For it has seemed good to the Holy Spirit, and to us, to impose upon you no further burden than these necessary things:

verses.latin: ut abstineatis vos a simulacrorum immolatis, et sanguine, et suffocato, et fornicatione: a quibus custodientes vos, bene agetis. Valete.
verses.english: that you abstain from things sacrificed to idols, and from blood, and from what is strangled, and from fornication: from which keeping yourselves, you shall do well. Farewell.”

verses.latin: Ipsi ergo dimissi, venerunt Antiochiam: et congregata multitudine, tradiderunt epistolam.
verses.english: So they, having been dismissed, went to Antioch: and gathering the multitude together, they delivered the letter.

verses.latin: Quam cum legissent, gavisi sunt super consolatione.
verses.english: When they had read it, they rejoiced over the consolation.

verses.latin: Judas quoque et Silas, et ipsi cum essent prophetæ, verbis multis exhortati fratres, et confirmaverunt.
verses.english: Judas and Silas, they also being prophets, with many words exhorted the brothers, and they strengthened them.

verses.latin: Facto autem illis ibi moram, dimissi sunt a fratribus cum pace ad eos, qui miserant illos.
verses.english: And after they had spent some time there, they were dismissed with peace by the brothers to those who had sent them.

verses.latin: Silæ vero visum est ibi remanere.
verses.english: But it seemed good to Silas to remain there.

verses.latin: Paulus autem et Barnabas demorabantur Antiochiae, docentes et evangelizantes cum aliis pluribus verbum Domini.
verses.english: But Paul and Barnabas continued in Antioch, teaching and evangelizing with many others the word of the Lord.

verses.latin: Post aliquot autem dies, dixit Paulus ad Barnabam: Revertentes iterum visitamus fratres per universas civitates, in quibus prædicavimus verbum Domini, quomodo se habeant.
verses.english: After some days, Paul said to Barnabas: “Let us return and visit the brothers through all the cities in which we have preached the word of the Lord, to see how they are doing.”

verses.latin: Barnabas autem volebat secum assumere et Joannem, qui cognominabatur Marcus.
verses.english: And Barnabas wanted to take with them also John, who was called Mark.

verses.latin: Paulus autem rogabat eum, qui discesserat ab eis de Pamphylia, et non ierat cum eis in opus, ut non sumerent hunc secum.
verses.english: But Paul was asking him not to take this one with them, who had departed from them in Pamphylia, and had not gone with them to the work.

verses.latin: Facta est autem dissensio, ita ut discessissent ab invicem, et Barnabas quidem, assumpto Marco, navigavit in Cyprum:
verses.english: There was a disagreement, so that they departed from each other, and Barnabas, taking Mark, sailed to Cyprus:

verses.latin: Paulus vero, electo Sila, profectus est, traditus gratiæ Dei a fratribus.
verses.english: But Paul, having chosen Silas, set out, having been delivered to the grace of God by the brothers.

verses.latin: Perambulabat autem Syriam et Ciliciam, confirmans ecclesias, præcipiens custodire præcepta Apostolorum et seniorum.
verses.english: And he was going through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the churches, commanding them to keep the precepts of the Apostles and elders.

verses.latin: Pervenit autem Derbe, et Lystram. Et ecce discipulus quidam erat ibi nomine Timotheus, filius mulieris fidelis Judææ, patre gentili.
verses.english: Paul next traveled to Derbe and Lystra. There was a disciple named Timothy there, the son of a Jewish woman who was a believer, and his father was a Gentile.

verses.latin: Huic testimonium reddebant qui in Lystra et Iconio erant fratres.
verses.english: The brothers at Lystra and Iconium gave a good report of him.

verses.latin: Hunc voluit Paulus secum proficisci: et assumens circumcidit eum propter Judæos, qui erant in illis locis: sciebant enim omnes quod pater ejus gentilis esset.
verses.english: Paul wanted Timothy to go with him. He had Timothy circumcised because of the Jews who were in those places, for they all knew that his father was a Gentile.

verses.latin: Cum autem pertransirent civitates, tradebant eis custodire dogmata, quæ erant decreta ab apostolis et senioribus, qui erant Jerosolymis.
verses.english: As they traveled from town to town, they passed along the decisions that had been made by the apostles and elders in Jerusalem, and the new churches obeyed these commands.

verses.latin: Et ecclesiæ quidem confirmabantur fide, et abundabant numero quotidie.
verses.english: So the churches were strengthened in the faith and grew daily in numbers.

verses.latin: Transeuntes autem Phrygiam et Galatiæ regionem, prohibiti sunt a Spiritu Sancto loqui verbum in Asia.
verses.english: Then they traveled through the Phrygian and Galatian regions, being prevented by the Holy Spirit from speaking the word in Asia.

verses.latin: Cum venissent autem in Mysiam, tentabant ire in Bithyniam: et non permisit eos Spiritus Jesu.
verses.english: When they came to Mysia, they tried to go to Bithynia, but the Spirit of Jesus did not allow them.

verses.latin: Cum autem pertransissent Mysiam, descenderunt Troadem.
verses.english: So they passed by Mysia and went down to Troas.

verses.latin: Et visio per noctem Paulo ostensa est. Vir Macedo quidam stabat, et deprecabatur eum, dicens: Transiens in Macedoniam, adjuva nos.
verses.english: During the night, Paul had a vision. A man of Macedonia was standing and begging him, saying, “Come over to Macedonia and help us.”

verses.latin: Ut autem visionem vidit, statim quæsimus proficisci in Macedoniam, judicantes a Deo nos vocatos esse ad evangelizandum eis.
verses.english: As soon as Paul had seen the vision, we immediately tried to go to Macedonia, concluding that God had called us to preach the gospel to them.

verses.latin: Navigantes autem a Troade, recta cursu venimus Samothraciam, et sequenti die Neapolim:
verses.english: Setting sail from Troas, we went straight to Samothrace, and the next day to Neapolis.

verses.latin: et inde Philippos, quæ est prima partis Macedoniæ civitas, et colonia. Eramus autem in hac urbe diebus aliquot agentes.
verses.english: From there we went to Philippi, a leading city of the district of Macedonia and a Roman colony. We remained in this city for some days.

verses.latin: Die autem sabbati egressi sumus foras portam juxta flumen, ubi videbamur orationem habere, et sedimus, et loquebamur mulieribus quæ convenerant.
verses.english: On the Sabbath, we went outside the gate to the riverside, where we thought there would be a place of prayer. We sat down and spoke to the women who had gathered there.

verses.latin: Et quædam mulier nomine Lydia, purpuraria, civitatis Thyatyræ, timens Deum, audiebat: cujus Dominus aperuit cor, adtendere his quæ dicebantur a Paulo.
verses.english: A woman named Lydia, a seller of purple cloth from the city of Thyatira, was listening. She was a worshiper of God, and the Lord opened her heart to pay attention to what Paul said.

verses.latin: Cum autem baptizata esset et domus ejus, deprecata est nos, dicens: Si judicastis me fidelem Domino esse, introite in domum meam, et manete. Et coëgit nos.
verses.english: After she and her household were baptized, she urged us, saying, “If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come to my house and stay.” And she compelled us.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, euntes nos ad orationem, puellam quamdam habentem spiritum pythonem, occurrisse nobis, quæ quæstu magna præstabat dominis suis divinando.
verses.english: One day as we were going to the place of prayer, we met a slave girl who had a spirit of divination and brought her owners a great profit by fortune-telling.

verses.latin: Hæc subsecuta Paulum et nos, clamabat, dicens: Hi homines servi Dei altissimi sunt, qui annuntiant vobis viam salutis.
verses.english: Following Paul and us, she kept crying out, saying, “These men are servants of the Most High God, who proclaim to you the way of salvation.”

verses.latin: Hoc autem faciebat multis diebus. Dolens autem Paulus, et conversus, spiritui dixit: Præcipio tibi in nomine Jesu Christi exire ab ea. Et exiit eadem hora.
verses.english: And she kept doing this for many days. But Paul, becoming greatly annoyed, turned and said to the spirit, “I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her.” And it came out that very hour.

verses.latin: Videntes autem domini ejus, quia exiit spes quæstus eorum, apprehendentes Paulum et Silam, traxerunt in forum ad principes:
verses.english: But when her owners saw that their hope of profit was gone, they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them to the marketplace before the authorities.

verses.latin: et offerentes eos magistratibus, dixerunt: Hi homines conturbant civitatem nostram, cum sint Judæi:
verses.english: And when they had brought them to the magistrates, they said, “These men are disturbing our city. They are Jews,

verses.latin: et annuntiant morem quem non licet nobis suscipere neque facere, cum simus Romani.
verses.english: and are proclaiming customs that are not lawful for us Romans to accept or practice.”

verses.latin: Et concurrens plebs adversus eos: et magistratus, rasis eis vestimentis, jussere eos virgis cædi.
verses.english: The crowd joined in attacking them, and the magistrates tore off their clothes and ordered them to be beaten with rods.

verses.latin: Et cum multas plagas eis intulissent, miserunt eos in carcerem, præcipientes custodi ut secure custodiret eos.
verses.english: And when they had inflicted many blows upon them, they threw them into prison, ordering the jailer to keep them safely.

verses.latin: Qui cum talem præceptum accepisset, misit eos in interiorem carcerem, et pedes eorum ligno vinxit.
verses.english: Having received this order, he put them into the inner prison and fastened their feet in the stocks.

verses.latin: Media autem nocte, Paulus et Silas orantes, laudabant Deum: et audiebant eos qui erant in vinculis.
verses.english: About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the other prisoners were listening to them.

verses.latin: Subito vero terræmotus factus est magnus, ita ut moverentur fundamenta carceris. Et statim aperta sunt ostia omnia, et vincula singulorum soluta sunt.
verses.english: Suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken. And immediately all the doors were opened, and everyone’s bonds were unfastened.

verses.latin: Expergefactus autem custos carceris, et videns januas apertas carceris, evaginato gladio, volebat se interficere, æstimans fugisse vinctos.
verses.english: When the jailer woke up and saw that the prison doors were open, he drew his sword and was about to kill himself, supposing that the prisoners had escaped.

verses.latin: Clamavit autem Paulus voce magna, dicens: Nihil feceris tibi mali: universi enim hic sumus.
verses.english: But Paul cried with a loud voice, “Do not harm yourself, for we are all here.”

verses.latin: Petito autem lucernis, introgressus est, et tremens præcidit Paulo et Silæ:
verses.english: And the jailer called for lights and rushed in, and trembling with fear, he fell down before Paul and Silas.

verses.latin: et proferens eos foras, ait: Domini, quid me oportet facere, ut salvus fiam?
verses.english: Then he brought them out and said, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”

verses.latin: At illi dixerunt: Crede in Dominum Jesum, et salvus eris tu, et domus tua.
verses.english: And they said, “Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved, you and your household.”

verses.latin: Et locuti sunt ei verbum Domini cum omnibus qui erant in domo ejus.
verses.english: Then they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all who were in his house.

verses.latin: Et assumens eos in illa hora noctis, lavit plagas eorum: et baptizatus est ipse, et omnes ejus continuo.
verses.english: And he took them that very hour of the night and washed their wounds; and immediately he was baptized, he and all his household.

verses.latin: Cumque introduxisset eos in domum suam, apposuit eis mensam, et lætatus est cum omni domo sua, credens Deo.
verses.english: Then he brought them up into his house and set food before them. And he rejoiced with all his household that he had believed in God.

verses.latin: Et cum dies factus esset, miserunt magistratus lictores, dicentes: Dimitte homines illos.
verses.english: But when it was day, the magistrates sent the police to say, “Release those men.”

verses.latin: Nuntiavit autem custos carceris Paulo verba hæc, dicens: Miserunt magistratus ut dimittamini: nunc igitur exeuntes, ite in pace.
verses.english: And the jailer reported these words to Paul, saying, “The magistrates have sent to release you. Therefore, come out now and go in peace.”

verses.latin: Paulus autem dixit eis: Cæsos nos publice, indemnatos, homines Romanos, miserunt in carcerem: et nunc clam dimittunt nos? Non ita, sed veniant ipsi,
verses.english: But Paul said to them, “They have beaten us publicly without a trial, men who are Roman citizens, and have thrown us into prison; and now they are secretly sending us away? No, let them come themselves and

verses.latin: et eiciant nos.
verses.english: take us out.”

verses.latin: Nuntiaverunt autem magistratibus lictores verba hæc. Timuerunt autem, audientes quod Romani essent:
verses.english: The police reported these words to the magistrates, and they were afraid when they heard that they were Roman citizens.

verses.latin: et venientes, deprecati sunt eos: et educentes, rogabant ut exirent de urbe.
verses.english: So they came and apologized to them. And they brought them out and asked them to leave the city.

verses.latin: Exientes autem de carcere, introierunt ad Lydiam: et visis fratribus, consolati sunt eos, et profecti sunt.
verses.english: So they went out of the prison and entered the house of Lydia. And when they had seen the brothers, they encouraged them and departed.

verses.latin: Cum autem perambulassent Amfipolim et Apolloniam, venerunt Thessalonicam, ubi erat synagoga Judaeorum.
verses.english: After Paul and Silas traveled through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they arrived in Thessalonica, where there was a Jewish synagogue.

verses.latin: Secundum consuetudinem autem Paulus introivit ad eos: et per sabbata tria disserebat eis de Scripturis,
verses.english: Paul then went into the synagogue, as was his custom. For three Sabbaths, he reasoned with them from the Scriptures,

verses.latin: adaperiens et proponens quoniam Christum oportuit pati, et resurgere a mortuis: et quia hic est Jesus, quem ego annuntio vobis.
verses.english: explaining and demonstrating that the Christ had to suffer, and to rise again from the dead. And he said, "This Jesus whom I announce to you is the Christ."

verses.latin: Et quidam ex eis crediderunt et adjuncti sunt Paulo et Silae, et de gentium religiosorum multitudo magna, et mulierum nobilium non paucae.
verses.english: Some of them were persuaded, and joined Paul and Silas, as did a large number of Gentile converts and many prominent women.

verses.latin: Invidiaverunt autem Judaei, et assumptis de foro viris malis, et turba concitata, concitabant civitatem, et inruentes in domum Jasonis, quaerebant eos producere in populum.
verses.english: But the Jews were jealous, and they gathered wicked men from the marketplace, and stirred up the city. They attacked the house of Jason, seeking to bring them out to the people.

verses.latin: Non invenientes autem, trahebant Jasonem, et quosdam fratres ad principes civitatis, clamantes: Quoniam hi qui urbem concitant, et huc venerunt,
verses.english: Not finding them, they dragged Jason and some of the brothers before the city authorities, shouting, "These men who have upset the world have come here too,

verses.latin: quos suscepit Jason: et hi contra decreta Caesaris omnia facientes, dicunt alium regem esse, Jesum.
verses.english: and Jason has received them. They are all acting against the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, Jesus."

verses.latin: Conturbaverunt autem plebem, et principes civitatis audientes haec.
verses.english: They stirred up the crowd and the city authorities who heard these things.

verses.latin: Et accepta satisfactione a Jason, et ceteris, dimiserunt eos.
verses.english: After taking security from Jason and the others, they let them go.

verses.latin: Fratres autem continuo per noctem dimiserunt Paulum et Silam in Beroeam: qui cum venissent, in synagogam Judaeorum introierunt.
verses.english: The brothers immediately sent Paul and Silas away by night to Beroea. When they arrived, they went into the Jewish synagogue.

verses.latin: Hi autem erant nobiliores eorum qui sunt Thessalonicæ, qui susceperunt verbum cum omni studio, quotidie scrutantes Scripturas, si ita se haberent.
verses.english: These Jews were more noble than those in Thessalonica, because they received the word with all eagerness, examining the Scriptures daily to see if these things were so.

verses.latin: Multi ergo ex eis crediderunt, et mulierum gentilium honorabilium, et virorum non pauci.
verses.english: Many of them therefore believed, as did quite a few of the distinguished Greek women and many men.

verses.latin: Cum autem cognovissent in Thessalonicam Judaei, quod et Beroeae praedicaretur a Paulo verbum Dei, venerunt et illuc commoventes, et turbantes multitudines.
verses.english: But when the Jews from Thessalonica learned that the word of God was preached by Paul in Beroea also, they came there too, stirring up and disturbing the crowds.

verses.latin: Statim autem tunc Paulum dimiserunt fratres, ut iret usque ad mare: Silas autem et Timotheus remanserunt ibi.
verses.english: Then the brothers immediately sent Paul away to go as far as the sea, but Silas and Timothy remained there.

verses.latin: Qui autem deducebant Paulum, perduxerunt eum usque Athenas: et accepto mandato ad Silam et Timotheum, ut quam cito venirent ad eum, discesserunt.
verses.english: Those who escorted Paul brought him to Athens. After receiving a command for Silas and Timothy to come to him as soon as possible, they departed.
